BitField.description: The delay from the nominal Sync point to the sample point is (this value plus one) CAN clocks.

BitField.name: TESG2
BitField.description: The delay from the sample point to the next nominal sync point is (this value plus one) CAN clocks. The nominal CAN bit time is (this value plus the value in TSEG1 plus 3) CAN clocks.

Enum.name: THE_BUS_IS_SAMPLED_O
Enum.description: The bus is sampled once (recommended for high speed buses)

Enum.name: THE_BUS_IS_SAMPLED_3
Enum.description: The bus is sampled 3 times (recommended for low to medium speed buses to filter spikes on the bus-line)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: EWL
Register.description: Error Warning Limit. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: EWL
BitField.description: During CAN operation, this value is compared to both the Tx and Rx Error Counters. If either of these counter matches this value, the Error Status (ES) bit in CANSR is set.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RBS_1
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. This bit is identical to the RBS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: DOS_1
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. This bit is identical to the DOS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: TBS1_1
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status 1.

Enum.name: LOCKED_SOFTWARE_CAN
Enum.description: Locked. Software cannot access the Tx Buffer 1 nor write to the corresponding CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers because a message is either waiting for transmission or is in transmitting process.

Enum.name: RELEASED_SOFTWARE_M
Enum.description: Released. Software may write a message into the Transmit Buffer 1 and its CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS1_1
BitField.description: Transmission Complete Status.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_THE_PREV
Enum.description: Incomplete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 1 is not complete.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_THE_PREVIO
Enum.description: Complete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 1 has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS_1
BitField.description: Receive Status. This bit is identical to the RS bit in the GSR.

BitField.name: TS1_1
BitField.description: Transmit Status 1.

Enum.name: IDLE_THERE_IS_NO_TR
Enum.description: Idle. There is no transmission from Tx Buffer 1.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN Controller is transmitting a message from Tx Buffer 1.

BitField.name: ES_1
BitField.description: Error Status. This bit is identical to the ES bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: BS_1
BitField.description: Bus Status. This bit is identical to the BS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: RBS_2
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. This bit is identical to the RBS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: DOS_2
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. This bit is identical to the DOS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: TBS2_2
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status 2.

Enum.name: LOCKED_SOFTWARE_CAN
Enum.description: Locked. Software cannot access the Tx Buffer 2 nor write to the corresponding CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers because a message is either waiting for transmission or is in transmitting process.

Enum.name: RELEASED_SOFTWARE_M
Enum.description: Released. Software may write a message into the Transmit Buffer 2 and its CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS2_2
BitField.description: Transmission Complete Status.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_THE_PREV
Enum.description: Incomplete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 2 is not complete.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_THE_PREVIO
Enum.description: Complete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 2 has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS_2
BitField.description: Receive Status. This bit is identical to the RS bit in the GSR.

BitField.name: TS2_2
BitField.description: Transmit Status 2.

Enum.name: IDLE_THERE_IS_NO_TR
Enum.description: Idle. There is no transmission from Tx Buffer 2.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN Controller is transmitting a message from Tx Buffer 2.

BitField.name: ES_2
BitField.description: Error Status. This bit is identical to the ES bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: BS_2
BitField.description: Bus Status. This bit is identical to the BS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: RBS_3
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. This bit is identical to the RBS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: DOS_3
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. This bit is identical to the DOS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: TBS3_3
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status 3.

Enum.name: LOCKED_SOFTWARE_CAN
Enum.description: Locked. Software cannot access the Tx Buffer 3 nor write to the corresponding CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers because a message is either waiting for transmission or is in transmitting process.

Enum.name: RELEASED_SOFTWARE_M
Enum.description: Released. Software may write a message into the Transmit Buffer 3 and its CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS3_3
BitField.description: Transmission Complete Status.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_THE_PREV
Enum.description: Incomplete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 3 is not complete.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_THE_PREVIO
Enum.description: Complete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 3 has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS_3
BitField.description: Receive Status. This bit is identical to the RS bit in the GSR.

BitField.name: TS3_3
BitField.description: Transmit Status 3.

Enum.name: IDLE_THERE_IS_NO_TR
Enum.description: Idle. There is no transmission from Tx Buffer 3.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN Controller is transmitting a message from Tx Buffer 3.

BitField.name: ES_3
BitField.description: Error Status. This bit is identical to the ES bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: BS_3
BitField.description: Bus Status. This bit is identical to the BS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RFS
Register.description: Receive frame status. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: IDINDEX
BitField.description: ID Index. If the BP bit (below) is 0, this value is the zero-based number of the Lookup Table RAM entry at which the Acceptance Filter matched the received Identifier. Disabled entries in the Standard tables are included in this numbering, but will not be matched. See Section 21.17 Examples of acceptance filter tables and ID index values on page 587 for examples of ID Index values.

BitField.name: BP
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, the current message was received in AF Bypass mode, and the ID Index field (above) is meaningless.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: The field contains the Data Length Code (DLC) field of the current received message. When RTR = 0, this is related to the number of data bytes available in the CANRDA and CANRDB registers as follows: 0000-0111 = 0 to 7 bytes1000-1111 = 8 bytes With RTR = 1, this value indicates the number of data bytes requested to be sent back, with the same encoding.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This bit contains the Remote Transmission Request bit of the current received message. 0 indicates a Data Frame, in which (if DLC is non-zero) data can be read from the CANRDA and possibly the CANRDB registers. 1 indicates a Remote frame, in which case the DLC value identifies the number of data bytes requested to be sent using the same Identifier.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: A 0 in this bit indicates that the current received message included an 11-bit Identifier, while a 1 indicates a 29-bit Identifier. This affects the contents of the CANid register described below.

Register.name: RID
Register.description: Received Identifier. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier field of the current received message. In CAN 2.0A, these bits are called ID10-0, while in CAN 2.0B they're called ID29-18.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RDA
Register.description: Received data bytes 1-4. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0001, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0010, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0011, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0100, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

Register.name: RDB
Register.description: Received data bytes 5-8. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0101, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0110, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0111, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 1000, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: If the TPM (Transmit Priority Mode) bit in the CANxMOD register is set to 1, enabled Tx Buffers contend for the right to send their messages based on this field. The buffer with the lowest TX Priority value wins the prioritization and is sent first.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Data Length Code. This value is sent in the DLC field of the next transmit message. In addition, if RTR = 0, this value controls the number of Data bytes sent in the next transmit message, from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers: 0000-0111 = 0-7 bytes 1xxx = 8 bytes

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This value is sent in the RTR bit of the next transmit message. If this bit is 0, the number of data bytes called out by the DLC field are sent from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers. If this bit is 1, a Remote Frame is sent, containing a request for that number of bytes.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: If this bit is 0, the next transmit message will be sent with an 11-bit Identifier (standard frame format), while if it's 1, the message will be sent with a 29-bit Identifier (extended frame format).

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: If the TPM (Transmit Priority Mode) bit in the CANxMOD register is set to 1, enabled Tx Buffers contend for the right to send their messages based on this field. The buffer with the lowest TX Priority value wins the prioritization and is sent first.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Data Length Code. This value is sent in the DLC field of the next transmit message. In addition, if RTR = 0, this value controls the number of Data bytes sent in the next transmit message, from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers: 0000-0111 = 0-7 bytes 1xxx = 8 bytes

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This value is sent in the RTR bit of the next transmit message. If this bit is 0, the number of data bytes called out by the DLC field are sent from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers. If this bit is 1, a Remote Frame is sent, containing a request for that number of bytes.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: If this bit is 0, the next transmit message will be sent with an 11-bit Identifier (standard frame format), while if it's 1, the message will be sent with a 29-bit Identifier (extended frame format).

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: If the TPM (Transmit Priority Mode) bit in the CANxMOD register is set to 1, enabled Tx Buffers contend for the right to send their messages based on this field. The buffer with the lowest TX Priority value wins the prioritization and is sent first.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Data Length Code. This value is sent in the DLC field of the next transmit message. In addition, if RTR = 0, this value controls the number of Data bytes sent in the next transmit message, from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers: 0000-0111 = 0-7 bytes 1xxx = 8 bytes

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This value is sent in the RTR bit of the next transmit message. If this bit is 0, the number of data bytes called out by the DLC field are sent from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers. If this bit is 1, a Remote Frame is sent, containing a request for that number of bytes.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: If this bit is 0, the next transmit message will be sent with an 11-bit Identifier (standard frame format), while if it's 1, the message will be sent with a 29-bit Identifier (extended frame format).

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier to be sent in the next transmit message.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier to be sent in the next transmit message.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier to be sent in the next transmit message.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0001 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the first Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0010 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 2nd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0011 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 3rd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0100 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 4th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0001 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the first Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0010 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 2nd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0011 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 3rd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0100 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 4th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0001 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the first Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0010 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 2nd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0011 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 3rd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0100 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 4th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0101 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 5th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0110 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 6th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0111 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 7th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 1000 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 8th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0101 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 5th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0110 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 6th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0111 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 7th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 1000 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 8th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0101 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 5th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0110 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 6th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0111 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 7th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 1000 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 8th Data byte of the next transmit message.

Register.name: MOD
Register.description: Controls the operating mode of the CAN Controller.

BitField.name: RM
BitField.description: Reset Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL_THE_CAN_CONTR
Enum.description: Normal.The CAN Controller is in the Operating Mode, and certain registers can not be written.

Enum.name: RESET_CAN_OPERATION
Enum.description: Reset. CAN operation is disabled, writable registers can be written and the current transmission/reception of a message is aborted.

BitField.name: LOM
BitField.description: Listen Only Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL_THE_CAN_CONT
Enum.description: Normal. The CAN controller acknowledges a successfully received message on the CAN bus. The error counters are stopped at the current value.

Enum.name: LISTEN_ONLY_THE_CON
Enum.description: Listen only. The controller gives no acknowledgment, even if a message is successfully received. Messages cannot be sent, and the controller operates in error passive mode. This mode is intended for software bit rate detection and hot plugging.

BitField.name: STM
BitField.description: Self Test Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL_A_TRANSMITTE
Enum.description: Normal. A transmitted message must be acknowledged to be considered successful.

Enum.name: SELF_TEST_THE_CONTR
Enum.description: Self test. The controller will consider a Tx message successful even if there is no acknowledgment received. In this mode a full node test is possible without any other active node on the bus using the SRR bit in CANxCMR.

BitField.name: TPM
BitField.description: Transmit Priority Mode.

Enum.name: CAN_ID_THE_TRANSMIT
Enum.description: CAN ID. The transmit priority for 3 Transmit Buffers depends on the CAN Identifier.

Enum.name: LOCAL_PRIORITY_THE_
Enum.description: Local priority. The transmit priority for 3 Transmit Buffers depends on the contents of the Tx Priority register within the Transmit Buffer.

BitField.name: SM
BitField.description: Sleep Mode.

Enum.name: WAKE_UP_NORMAL_OPER
Enum.description: Wake-up. Normal operation.

Enum.name: SLEEP_THE_CAN_CONTR
Enum.description: Sleep. The CAN controller enters Sleep Mode if no CAN interrupt is pending and there is no bus activity. See the Sleep Mode description Section 21.8.2 on page 565.

BitField.name: RPM
BitField.description: Receive Polarity Mode.

Enum.name: LOW_ACTIVE_RD_INPUT
Enum.description: Low active. RD input is active Low (dominant bit = 0).

Enum.name: HIGH_ACTIVE_RD_INPU
Enum.description: High active. RD input is active High (dominant bit = 1) -- reverse polarity.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TM
BitField.description: Test Mode.

Enum.name: DISABLED_NORMAL_OPE
Enum.description: Disabled. Normal operation.

Enum.name: ENABLED_THE_TD_PIN_
Enum.description: Enabled. The TD pin will reflect the bit, detected on RD pin, with the next positive edge of the system clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CMR
Register.description: Command bits that affect the state of the CAN Controller

BitField.name: TR
BitField.description: Transmission Request.

Enum.name: ABSENT_NO_TRANSMISSI
Enum.description: Absent.No transmission request.

Enum.name: PRESENT_THE_MESSAGE
Enum.description: Present. The message, previously written to the CANxTFI, CANxTID, and optionally the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers, is queued for transmission from the selected Transmit Buffer. If at two or all three of STB1, STB2 and STB3 bits are selected when TR=1 is written, Transmit Buffer will be selected based on the chosen priority scheme (for details see Section 21.5.3 Transmit Buffers (TXB))

BitField.name: AT
BitField.description: Abort Transmission.

Enum.name: NO_ACTION_DO_NOT_AB
Enum.description: No action. Do not abort the transmission.

Enum.name: PRESENT_IF_NOT_ALRE
Enum.description: Present. if not already in progress, a pending Transmission Request for the selected Transmit Buffer is cancelled.

BitField.name: RRB
BitField.description: Release Receive Buffer.

Enum.name: NO_ACTION_DO_NOT_RE
Enum.description: No action. Do not release the receive buffer.

Enum.name: RELEASED_THE_INFORM
Enum.description: Released. The information in the Receive Buffer (consisting of CANxRFS, CANxRID, and if applicable the CANxRDA and CANxRDB registers) is released, and becomes eligible for replacement by the next received frame. If the next received frame is not available, writing this command clears the RBS bit in the Status Register(s).

BitField.name: CDO
BitField.description: Clear Data Overrun.

Enum.name: NO_ACTION_DO_NOT_CL
Enum.description: No action. Do not clear the data overrun bit.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_DATA_OVER
Enum.description: Clear. The Data Overrun bit in Status Register(s) is cleared.

BitField.name: SRR
BitField.description: Self Reception Request.

Enum.name: ABSENT_NO_SELF_RECE
Enum.description: Absent. No self reception request.

Enum.name: PRESENT_THE_MESSAGE
Enum.description: Present. The message, previously written to the CANxTFS, CANxTID, and optionally the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers, is queued for transmission from the selected Transmit Buffer and received simultaneously. This differs from the TR bit above in that the receiver is not disabled during the transmission, so that it receives the message if its Identifier is recognized by the Acceptance Filter.

BitField.name: STB1
BitField.description: Select Tx Buffer 1.

Enum.name: NOT_SELECTED_TX_BUF
Enum.description: Not selected. Tx Buffer 1 is not selected for transmission.

Enum.name: SELECTED_TX_BUFFER_
Enum.description: Selected. Tx Buffer 1 is selected for transmission.

BitField.name: STB2
BitField.description: Select Tx Buffer 2.

Enum.name: NOT_SELECTED_TX_BUF
Enum.description: Not selected. Tx Buffer 2 is not selected for transmission.

Enum.name: SELECTED_TX_BUFFER_
Enum.description: Selected. Tx Buffer 2 is selected for transmission.

BitField.name: STB3
BitField.description: Select Tx Buffer 3.

Enum.name: NOT_SELECTED_TX_BUF
Enum.description: Not selected. Tx Buffer 3 is not selected for transmission.

Enum.name: SELECTED_TX_BUFFER_
Enum.description: Selected. Tx Buffer 3 is selected for transmission.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: GSR
Register.description: Global Controller Status and Error Counters. The error counters can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: RBS
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. After reading all messages and releasing their memory space with the command 'Release Receive Buffer,' this bit is cleared.

Enum.name: EMPTY_NO_MESSAGE_IS
Enum.description: Empty. No message is available.

Enum.name: FULL_AT_LEAST_ONE_C
Enum.description: Full. At least one complete message is received by the Double Receive Buffer and available in the CANxRFS, CANxRID, and if applicable the CANxRDA and CANxRDB registers. This bit is cleared by the Release Receive Buffer command in CANxCMR, if no subsequent received message is available.

BitField.name: DOS
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. If there is not enough space to store the message within the Receive Buffer, that message is dropped and the Data Overrun condition is signalled to the CPU in the moment this message becomes valid. If this message is not completed successfully (e.g. because of an error), no overrun condition is signalled.

Enum.name: ABSENT_NO_DATA_OVER
Enum.description: Absent. No data overrun has occurred since the last Clear Data Overrun command was given/written to CANxCMR (or since Reset).

Enum.name: OVERRUN_A_MESSAGE_W
Enum.description: Overrun. A message was lost because the preceding message to this CAN controller was not read and released quickly enough (there was not enough space for a new message in the Double Receive Buffer).

BitField.name: TBS
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status.

Enum.name: LOCKED_AT_LEAST_ONE
Enum.description: Locked. At least one of the Transmit Buffers is not available for the CPU, i.e. at least one previously queued message for this CAN controller has not yet been sent, and therefore software should not write to the CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, nor CANxTDB registers of that (those) Tx buffer(s).

Enum.name: RELEASED_ALL_THREE_
Enum.description: Released. All three Transmit Buffers are available for the CPU. No transmit message is pending for this CAN controller (in any of the 3 Tx buffers), and software may write to any of the CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS
BitField.description: Transmit Complete Status. The Transmission Complete Status bit is set '0' (incomplete) whenever the Transmission Request bit or the Self Reception Request bit is set '1' at least for one of the three Transmit Buffers. The Transmission Complete Status bit will remain '0' until all messages are transmitted successfully.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_AT_LEAST
Enum.description: Incomplete. At least one requested transmission has not been successfully completed yet.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_ALL_REQUES
Enum.description: Complete. All requested transmission(s) has (have) been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS
BitField.description: Receive Status. If both the Receive Status and the Transmit Status bits are '0' (idle), the CAN-Bus is idle. If both bits are set, the controller is waiting to become idle again. After hardware reset 11 consecutive recessive bits have to be detected until idle status is reached. After Bus-off this will take 128 times of 11 consecutive recessive bits.

Enum.name: IDLE_THE_CAN_CONTRO
Enum.description: Idle. The CAN controller is idle.

Enum.name: RECEIVE_THE_CAN_CON
Enum.description: Receive. The CAN controller is receiving a message.

BitField.name: TS
BitField.description: Transmit Status. If both the Receive Status and the Transmit Status bits are '0' (idle), the CAN-Bus is idle. If both bits are set, the controller is waiting to become idle again. After hardware reset 11 consecutive recessive bits have to be detected until idle status is reached. After Bus-off this will take 128 times of 11 consecutive recessive bits.

Enum.name: IDLE_THE_CAN_CONTRO
Enum.description: Idle. The CAN controller is idle.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN controller is sending a message.

BitField.name: ES
BitField.description: Error Status. Errors detected during reception or transmission will effect the error counters according to the CAN specification. The Error Status bit is set when at least one of the error counters has reached or exceeded the Error Warning Limit. An Error Warning Interrupt is generated, if enabled. The default value of the Error Warning Limit after hardware reset is 96 decimal, see also Section 21.7.7 CAN Error Warning Limit register (CAN1EWL - 0x4004 4018, CAN2EWL - 0x4004 8018).

Enum.name: OK_BOTH_ERROR_COUNT
Enum.description: OK. Both error counters are below the Error Warning Limit.

Enum.name: ERROR_ONE_OR_BOTH_O
Enum.description: Error. One or both of the Transmit and Receive Error Counters has reached the limit set in the Error Warning Limit register.

BitField.name: BS
BitField.description: Bus Status. Mode bit '1' (present) and an Error Warning Interrupt is generated, if enabled. Afterwards the Transmit Error Counter is set to '127', and the Receive Error Counter is cleared. It will stay in this mode until the CPU clears the Reset Mode bit. Once this is completed the CAN Controller will wait the minimum protocol-defined time (128 occurrences of the Bus-Free signal) counting down the Transmit Error Counter. After that, the Bus Status bit is cleared (Bus-On), the Error Status bit is set '0' (ok), the Error Counters are reset, and an Error Warning Interrupt is generated, if enabled. Reading the TX Error Counter during this time gives information about the status of the Bus-Off recovery.

Enum.name: BUS_ON_THE_CAN_CONT
Enum.description: Bus-on. The CAN Controller is involved in bus activities

Enum.name: BUS_OFF_THE_CAN_CON
Enum.description: Bus-off. The CAN controller is currently not involved/prohibited from bus activity because the Transmit Error Counter reached its limiting value of 255.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RXERR
BitField.description: The current value of the Rx Error Counter (an 8-bit value).

BitField.name: TXERR
BitField.description: The current value of the Tx Error Counter (an 8-bit value).

Register.name: ICR
Register.description: Interrupt status, Arbitration Lost Capture, Error Code Capture

BitField.name: RI
BitField.description: Receive Interrupt. This bit is set whenever the RBS bit in CANxSR and the RIE bit in CANxIER are both 1, indicating that a new message was received and stored in the Receive Buffer. The Receive Interrupt Bit is not cleared upon a read access to the Interrupt Register. Giving the Command Release Receive Buffer will clear RI temporarily. If there is another message available within the Receive Buffer after the release command, RI is set again. Otherwise RI remains cleared.

BitField.name: TI1
BitField.description: Transmit Interrupt 1. This bit is set when the TBS1 bit in CANxSR goes from 0 to 1 (whenever a message out of TXB1 was successfully transmitted or aborted), indicating that Transmit buffer 1 is available, and the TIE1 bit in CANxIER is 1.

BitField.name: EI
BitField.description: Error Warning Interrupt. This bit is set on every change (set or clear) of either the Error Status or Bus Status bit in CANxSR and the EIE bit bit is set within the Interrupt Enable Register at the time of the change.

BitField.name: DOI
BitField.description: Data Overrun Interrupt. This bit is set when the DOS bit in CANxSR goes from 0 to 1 and the DOIE bit in CANxIER is 1.

BitField.name: WUI
BitField.description: Wake-Up Interrupt. This bit is set if the CAN controller is sleeping and bus activity is detected and the WUIE bit in CANxIER is 1. A Wake-Up Interrupt is also generated if the CPU tries to set the Sleep bit while the CAN controller is involved in bus activities or a CAN Interrupt is pending. The WUI flag can also get asserted when the according enable bit WUIE is not set. In this case a Wake-Up Interrupt does not get asserted.

BitField.name: EPI
BitField.description: Error Passive Interrupt. This bit is set if the EPIE bit in CANxIER is 1, and the CAN controller switches between Error Passive and Error Active mode in either direction. This is the case when the CAN Controller has reached the Error Passive Status (at least one error counter exceeds the CAN protocol defined level of 127) or if the CAN Controller is in Error Passive Status and enters the Error Active Status again.

BitField.name: ALI
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost Interrupt. This bit is set if the ALIE bit in CANxIER is 1, and the CAN controller loses arbitration while attempting to transmit. In this case the CAN node becomes a receiver.

BitField.name: BEI
BitField.description: Bus Error Interrupt -- this bit is set if the BEIE bit in CANxIER is 1, and the CAN controller detects an error on the bus.

BitField.name: IDI
BitField.description: ID Ready Interrupt -- this bit is set if the IDIE bit in CANxIER is 1, and a CAN Identifier has been received (a message was successfully transmitted or aborted). This bit is set whenever a message was successfully transmitted or aborted and the IDIE bit is set in the IER register.

BitField.name: TI2
BitField.description: Transmit Interrupt 2. This bit is set when the TBS2 bit in CANxSR goes from 0 to 1 (whenever a message out of TXB2 was successfully transmitted or aborted), indicating that Transmit buffer 2 is available, and the TIE2 bit in CANxIER is 1.

BitField.name: TI3
BitField.description: Transmit Interrupt 3. This bit is set when the TBS3 bit in CANxSR goes from 0 to 1 (whenever a message out of TXB3 was successfully transmitted or aborted), indicating that Transmit buffer 3 is available, and the TIE3 bit in CANxIER is 1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: ERRBIT4_0
BitField.description: Error Code Capture: when the CAN controller detects a bus error, the location of the error within the frame is captured in this field. The value reflects an internal state variable, and as a result is not very linear: 00011 = Start of Frame 00010 = ID28 ... ID21 00110 = ID20 ... ID18 00100 = SRTR Bit 00101 = IDE bit 00111 = ID17 ... 13 01111 = ID12 ... ID5 01110 = ID4 ... ID0 01100 = RTR Bit 01101 = Reserved Bit 1 01001 = Reserved Bit 0 01011 = Data Length Code 01010 = Data Field 01000 = CRC Sequence 11000 = CRC Delimiter 11001 = Acknowledge Slot 11011 = Acknowledge Delimiter 11010 = End of Frame 10010 = Intermission Whenever a bus error occurs, the corresponding bus error interrupt is forced, if enabled. At the same time, the current position of the Bit Stream Processor is captured into the Error Code Capture Register. The content within this register is fixed until the user software has read out its content once. From now on, the capture mechanism is activated again, i.e. reading the CANxICR enables another Bus Error Interrupt.

BitField.name: ERRDIR
BitField.description: When the CAN controller detects a bus error, the direction of the current bit is captured in this bit.

Enum.name: ERROR_OCCURRED_DURIN
Enum.description: Error occurred during transmitting.

Enum.name: ERROR_OCCURRED_DURIN
Enum.description: Error occurred during receiving.

BitField.name: ERRC1_0
BitField.description: When the CAN controller detects a bus error, the type of error is captured in this field:

Enum.name: BIT_ERROR
Enum.description: Bit error

Enum.name: FORM_ERROR
Enum.description: Form error

Enum.name: STUFF_ERROR
Enum.description: Stuff error

Enum.name: OTHER_ERROR
Enum.description: Other error

BitField.name: ALCBIT
BitField.description: Each time arbitration is lost while trying to send on the CAN, the bit number within the frame is captured into this field. After the content of ALCBIT is read, the ALI bit is cleared and a new Arbitration Lost interrupt can occur. 00 = arbitration lost in the first bit (MS) of identifier ... 11 = arbitration lost in SRTS bit (RTR bit for standard frame messages) 12 = arbitration lost in IDE bit 13 = arbitration lost in 12th bit of identifier (extended frame only) ... 30 = arbitration lost in last bit of identifier (extended frame only) 31 = arbitration lost in RTR bit (extended frame only) On arbitration lost, the corresponding arbitration lost interrupt is forced, if enabled. At that time, the current bit position of the Bit Stream Processor is captured into the Arbitration Lost Capture Register. The content within this register is fixed until the user application has read out its contents once. From now on, the capture mechanism is activated again.

BitField.name: RIE
BitField.description: Receiver Interrupt Enable. When the Receive Buffer Status is 'full', the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: TIE1
BitField.description: Transmit Interrupt Enable for Buffer1. When a message has been successfully transmitted out of TXB1 or Transmit Buffer 1 is accessible again (e.g. after an Abort Transmission command), the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: EIE
BitField.description: Error Warning Interrupt Enable. If the Error or Bus Status change (see Status Register), the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: DOIE
BitField.description: Data Overrun Interrupt Enable. If the Data Overrun Status bit is set (see Status Register), the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: WUIE
BitField.description: Wake-Up Interrupt Enable. If the sleeping CAN controller wakes up, the respective interrupt is requested.

BitField.name: EPIE
BitField.description: Error Passive Interrupt Enable. If the error status of the CAN Controller changes from error active to error passive or vice versa, the respective interrupt is requested.

BitField.name: ALIE
BitField.description: Arbitration Lost Interrupt Enable. If the CAN Controller has lost arbitration, the respective interrupt is requested.

BitField.name: BEIE
BitField.description: Bus Error Interrupt Enable. If a bus error has been detected, the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: IDIE
BitField.description: ID Ready Interrupt Enable. When a CAN identifier has been received, the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: TIE2
BitField.description: Transmit Interrupt Enable for Buffer2. When a message has been successfully transmitted out of TXB2 or Transmit Buffer 2 is accessible again (e.g. after an Abort Transmission command), the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: TIE3
BitField.description: Transmit Interrupt Enable for Buffer3. When a message has been successfully transmitted out of TXB3 or Transmit Buffer 3 is accessible again (e.g. after an Abort Transmission command), the CAN Controller requests the respective interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: BTR
Register.description: Bus Timing. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: BRP
BitField.description: Baud Rate Prescaler. The APB clock is divided by (this value plus one) to produce the CAN clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SJW
BitField.description: The Synchronization Jump Width is (this value plus one) CAN clocks.

BitField.name: TESG1
BitField.description: The delay from the nominal Sync point to the sample point is (this value plus one) CAN clocks.

BitField.name: TESG2
BitField.description: The delay from the sample point to the next nominal sync point is (this value plus one) CAN clocks. The nominal CAN bit time is (this value plus the value in TSEG1 plus 3) CAN clocks.

Enum.name: THE_BUS_IS_SAMPLED_O
Enum.description: The bus is sampled once (recommended for high speed buses)

Enum.name: THE_BUS_IS_SAMPLED_3
Enum.description: The bus is sampled 3 times (recommended for low to medium speed buses to filter spikes on the bus-line)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: EWL
Register.description: Error Warning Limit. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: EWL
BitField.description: During CAN operation, this value is compared to both the Tx and Rx Error Counters. If either of these counter matches this value, the Error Status (ES) bit in CANSR is set.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RBS_1
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. This bit is identical to the RBS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: DOS_1
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. This bit is identical to the DOS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: TBS1_1
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status 1.

Enum.name: LOCKED_SOFTWARE_CAN
Enum.description: Locked. Software cannot access the Tx Buffer 1 nor write to the corresponding CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers because a message is either waiting for transmission or is in transmitting process.

Enum.name: RELEASED_SOFTWARE_M
Enum.description: Released. Software may write a message into the Transmit Buffer 1 and its CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS1_1
BitField.description: Transmission Complete Status.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_THE_PREV
Enum.description: Incomplete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 1 is not complete.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_THE_PREVIO
Enum.description: Complete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 1 has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS_1
BitField.description: Receive Status. This bit is identical to the RS bit in the GSR.

BitField.name: TS1_1
BitField.description: Transmit Status 1.

Enum.name: IDLE_THERE_IS_NO_TR
Enum.description: Idle. There is no transmission from Tx Buffer 1.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN Controller is transmitting a message from Tx Buffer 1.

BitField.name: ES_1
BitField.description: Error Status. This bit is identical to the ES bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: BS_1
BitField.description: Bus Status. This bit is identical to the BS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: RBS_2
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. This bit is identical to the RBS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: DOS_2
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. This bit is identical to the DOS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: TBS2_2
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status 2.

Enum.name: LOCKED_SOFTWARE_CAN
Enum.description: Locked. Software cannot access the Tx Buffer 2 nor write to the corresponding CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers because a message is either waiting for transmission or is in transmitting process.

Enum.name: RELEASED_SOFTWARE_M
Enum.description: Released. Software may write a message into the Transmit Buffer 2 and its CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS2_2
BitField.description: Transmission Complete Status.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_THE_PREV
Enum.description: Incomplete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 2 is not complete.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_THE_PREVIO
Enum.description: Complete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 2 has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS_2
BitField.description: Receive Status. This bit is identical to the RS bit in the GSR.

BitField.name: TS2_2
BitField.description: Transmit Status 2.

Enum.name: IDLE_THERE_IS_NO_TR
Enum.description: Idle. There is no transmission from Tx Buffer 2.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN Controller is transmitting a message from Tx Buffer 2.

BitField.name: ES_2
BitField.description: Error Status. This bit is identical to the ES bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: BS_2
BitField.description: Bus Status. This bit is identical to the BS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: RBS_3
BitField.description: Receive Buffer Status. This bit is identical to the RBS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: DOS_3
BitField.description: Data Overrun Status. This bit is identical to the DOS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: TBS3_3
BitField.description: Transmit Buffer Status 3.

Enum.name: LOCKED_SOFTWARE_CAN
Enum.description: Locked. Software cannot access the Tx Buffer 3 nor write to the corresponding CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers because a message is either waiting for transmission or is in transmitting process.

Enum.name: RELEASED_SOFTWARE_M
Enum.description: Released. Software may write a message into the Transmit Buffer 3 and its CANxTFI, CANxTID, CANxTDA, and CANxTDB registers.

BitField.name: TCS3_3
BitField.description: Transmission Complete Status.

Enum.name: INCOMPLETE_THE_PREV
Enum.description: Incomplete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 3 is not complete.

Enum.name: COMPLETE_THE_PREVIO
Enum.description: Complete. The previously requested transmission for Tx Buffer 3 has been successfully completed.

BitField.name: RS_3
BitField.description: Receive Status. This bit is identical to the RS bit in the GSR.

BitField.name: TS3_3
BitField.description: Transmit Status 3.

Enum.name: IDLE_THERE_IS_NO_TR
Enum.description: Idle. There is no transmission from Tx Buffer 3.

Enum.name: TRANSMIT_THE_CAN_CO
Enum.description: Transmit. The CAN Controller is transmitting a message from Tx Buffer 3.

BitField.name: ES_3
BitField.description: Error Status. This bit is identical to the ES bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: BS_3
BitField.description: Bus Status. This bit is identical to the BS bit in the CANxGSR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, the value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RFS
Register.description: Receive frame status. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: IDINDEX
BitField.description: ID Index. If the BP bit (below) is 0, this value is the zero-based number of the Lookup Table RAM entry at which the Acceptance Filter matched the received Identifier. Disabled entries in the Standard tables are included in this numbering, but will not be matched. See Section 21.17 Examples of acceptance filter tables and ID index values on page 587 for examples of ID Index values.

BitField.name: BP
BitField.description: If this bit is 1, the current message was received in AF Bypass mode, and the ID Index field (above) is meaningless.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: The field contains the Data Length Code (DLC) field of the current received message. When RTR = 0, this is related to the number of data bytes available in the CANRDA and CANRDB registers as follows: 0000-0111 = 0 to 7 bytes1000-1111 = 8 bytes With RTR = 1, this value indicates the number of data bytes requested to be sent back, with the same encoding.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This bit contains the Remote Transmission Request bit of the current received message. 0 indicates a Data Frame, in which (if DLC is non-zero) data can be read from the CANRDA and possibly the CANRDB registers. 1 indicates a Remote frame, in which case the DLC value identifies the number of data bytes requested to be sent using the same Identifier.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: A 0 in this bit indicates that the current received message included an 11-bit Identifier, while a 1 indicates a 29-bit Identifier. This affects the contents of the CANid register described below.

Register.name: RID
Register.description: Received Identifier. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier field of the current received message. In CAN 2.0A, these bits are called ID10-0, while in CAN 2.0B they're called ID29-18.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RDA
Register.description: Received data bytes 1-4. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0001, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0010, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0011, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0100, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

Register.name: RDB
Register.description: Received data bytes 5-8. Can only be written when RM in CANMOD is 1.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0101, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0110, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 0111, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If the DLC field in CANRFS >= 1000, this contains the first Data byte of the current received message.

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: If the TPM (Transmit Priority Mode) bit in the CANxMOD register is set to 1, enabled Tx Buffers contend for the right to send their messages based on this field. The buffer with the lowest TX Priority value wins the prioritization and is sent first.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Data Length Code. This value is sent in the DLC field of the next transmit message. In addition, if RTR = 0, this value controls the number of Data bytes sent in the next transmit message, from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers: 0000-0111 = 0-7 bytes 1xxx = 8 bytes

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This value is sent in the RTR bit of the next transmit message. If this bit is 0, the number of data bytes called out by the DLC field are sent from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers. If this bit is 1, a Remote Frame is sent, containing a request for that number of bytes.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: If this bit is 0, the next transmit message will be sent with an 11-bit Identifier (standard frame format), while if it's 1, the message will be sent with a 29-bit Identifier (extended frame format).

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: If the TPM (Transmit Priority Mode) bit in the CANxMOD register is set to 1, enabled Tx Buffers contend for the right to send their messages based on this field. The buffer with the lowest TX Priority value wins the prioritization and is sent first.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Data Length Code. This value is sent in the DLC field of the next transmit message. In addition, if RTR = 0, this value controls the number of Data bytes sent in the next transmit message, from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers: 0000-0111 = 0-7 bytes 1xxx = 8 bytes

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This value is sent in the RTR bit of the next transmit message. If this bit is 0, the number of data bytes called out by the DLC field are sent from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers. If this bit is 1, a Remote Frame is sent, containing a request for that number of bytes.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: If this bit is 0, the next transmit message will be sent with an 11-bit Identifier (standard frame format), while if it's 1, the message will be sent with a 29-bit Identifier (extended frame format).

BitField.name: PRIO
BitField.description: If the TPM (Transmit Priority Mode) bit in the CANxMOD register is set to 1, enabled Tx Buffers contend for the right to send their messages based on this field. The buffer with the lowest TX Priority value wins the prioritization and is sent first.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLC
BitField.description: Data Length Code. This value is sent in the DLC field of the next transmit message. In addition, if RTR = 0, this value controls the number of Data bytes sent in the next transmit message, from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers: 0000-0111 = 0-7 bytes 1xxx = 8 bytes

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RTR
BitField.description: This value is sent in the RTR bit of the next transmit message. If this bit is 0, the number of data bytes called out by the DLC field are sent from the CANxTDA and CANxTDB registers. If this bit is 1, a Remote Frame is sent, containing a request for that number of bytes.

BitField.name: FF
BitField.description: If this bit is 0, the next transmit message will be sent with an 11-bit Identifier (standard frame format), while if it's 1, the message will be sent with a 29-bit Identifier (extended frame format).

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier to be sent in the next transmit message.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier to be sent in the next transmit message.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ID
BitField.description: The 11-bit Identifier to be sent in the next transmit message.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0001 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the first Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0010 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 2nd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0011 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 3rd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0100 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 4th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0001 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the first Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0010 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 2nd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0011 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 3rd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0100 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 4th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA1
BitField.description: Data 1. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0001 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the first Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA2
BitField.description: Data 2. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0010 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 2nd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA3
BitField.description: Data 3. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0011 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 3rd Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA4
BitField.description: Data 4. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0100 in the corresponding CANxTFI, this byte is sent as the 4th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0101 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 5th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0110 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 6th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0111 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 7th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 1000 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 8th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0101 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 5th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0110 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 6th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0111 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 7th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 1000 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 8th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA5
BitField.description: Data 5. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0101 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 5th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA6
BitField.description: Data 6. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0110 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 6th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA7
BitField.description: Data 7. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 0111 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 7th Data byte of the next transmit message.

BitField.name: DATA8
BitField.description: Data 8. If RTR = 0 and DLC >= 1000 in the corresponding CANTFI, this byte is sent as the 8th Data byte of the next transmit message.

Register.name: CONSET
Register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AA
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: I2C interrupt flag.

BitField.name: STO
BitField.description: STOP flag.

BitField.name: STA
BitField.description: START flag.

BitField.name: I2EN
BitField.description: I2C interface enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

BitField.name: Status
BitField.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAT
Register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR0
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLH
Register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLL
Register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. SCLL and SCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONCLR
Register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AAC
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

BitField.name: SIC
BitField.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STAC
BitField.description: START flag Clear bit.

BitField.name: I2ENC
BitField.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MM_ENA
BitField.description: Monitor mode enable.

Enum.name: MONITOR_MODE_DISABLE
Enum.description: Monitor mode disabled.

Enum.name: THE_I_2C_MODULE_WILL
Enum.description: The I 2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

BitField.name: ENA_SCL
BitField.description: SCL output enable.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

BitField.name: MATCH_ALL
BitField.description: Select interrupt register match.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

Register.name: ADR1
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR2
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR3
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DATA_BUFFER
Register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR0
Register.description: Control Register 0. Selects the serial clock rate, bus type, and data size.

BitField.name: DSS
BitField.description: Data Size Select. This field controls the number of bits transferred in each frame. Values 0000-0010 are not supported and should not be used.

Enum.name: 4_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 4-bit transfer

Enum.name: 5_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 5-bit transfer

Enum.name: 6_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 6-bit transfer

Enum.name: 7_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 7-bit transfer

Enum.name: 8_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 8-bit transfer

Enum.name: 9_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 9-bit transfer

Enum.name: 10_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 10-bit transfer

Enum.name: 11_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 11-bit transfer

Enum.name: 12_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 12-bit transfer

Enum.name: 13_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 13-bit transfer

Enum.name: 14_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 14-bit transfer

Enum.name: 15_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 15-bit transfer

Enum.name: 16_BIT_TRANSFER
Enum.description: 16-bit transfer

BitField.name: FRF
BitField.description: Frame Format.

Enum.name: THIS_COMBINATION_IS_
Enum.description: This combination is not supported and should not be used.

BitField.name: CPOL
BitField.description: Clock Out Polarity. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: BUS_LOW
Enum.description: SSP controller maintains the bus clock low between frames.

Enum.name: BUS_HIGH
Enum.description: SSP controller maintains the bus clock high between frames.

BitField.name: CPHA
BitField.description: Clock Out Phase. This bit is only used in SPI mode.

Enum.name: FIRST_CLOCK
Enum.description: SSP controller captures serial data on the first clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition away from the inter-frame state of the clock line.

Enum.name: SECOND_CLOCK
Enum.description: SSP controller captures serial data on the second clock transition of the frame, that is, the transition back to the inter-frame state of the clock line.

BitField.name: SCR
BitField.description: Serial Clock Rate. The number of prescaler-output clocks per bit on the bus, minus one. Given that CPSDVSR is the prescale divider, and the APB clock PCLK clocks the prescaler, the bit frequency is PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CR1
Register.description: Control Register 1. Selects master/slave and other modes.

BitField.name: LBM
BitField.description: Loop Back Mode.

Enum.name: NORMAL
Enum.description: During normal operation.

Enum.name: OUPTU
Enum.description: Serial input is taken from the serial output (MOSI or MISO) rather than the serial input pin (MISO or MOSI respectively).

BitField.name: SSE
BitField.description: SSP Enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The SSP controller is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The SSP controller will interact with other devices on the serial bus. Software should write the appropriate control information to the other SSP registers and interrupt controller registers, before setting this bit.

BitField.name: MS
BitField.description: Master/Slave Mode.This bit can only be written when the SSE bit is 0.

Enum.name: MASTER
Enum.description: The SSP controller acts as a master on the bus, driving the SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines and receiving the MISO line.

Enum.name: SLAVE
Enum.description: The SSP controller acts as a slave on the bus, driving MISO line and receiving SCLK, MOSI, and SSEL lines.

BitField.name: SOD
BitField.description: Slave Output Disable. This bit is relevant only in slave mode (MS = 1). If it is 1, this blocks this SSP controller from driving the transmit data line (MISO).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DR
Register.description: Data Register. Writes fill the transmit FIFO, and reads empty the receive FIFO.

BitField.name: DATA
BitField.description: Write: software can write data to be sent in a future frame to this register whenever the TNF bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Tx FIFO is not full. If the Tx FIFO was previously empty and the SSP controller is not busy on the bus, transmission of the data will begin immediately. Otherwise the data written to this register will be sent as soon as all previous data has been sent (and received). If the data length is less than 16 bits, software must right-justify the data written to this register. Read: software can read data from this register whenever the RNE bit in the Status register is 1, indicating that the Rx FIFO is not empty. When software reads this register, the SSP controller returns data from the least recent frame in the Rx FIFO. If the data length is less than 16 bits, the data is right-justified in this field with higher order bits filled with 0s.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. This bit is 1 is the Transmit FIFO is empty, 0 if not.

BitField.name: TNF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full. This bit is 0 if the Tx FIFO is full, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RNE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Not Empty. This bit is 0 if the Receive FIFO is empty, 1 if not.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full. This bit is 1 if the Receive FIFO is full, 0 if not.

BitField.name: BSY
BitField.description: Busy. This bit is 0 if the SSPn controller is idle, or 1 if it is currently sending/receiving a frame and/or the Tx FIFO is not empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CPSDVSR
BitField.description: This even value between 2 and 254, by which PCLK is divided to yield the prescaler output clock. Bit 0 always reads as 0.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IMSC
Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set and Clear Register

BitField.name: RORIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Overrun occurs, that is, when the Rx FIFO is full and another frame is completely received. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when a Receive Time-out condition occurs. A Receive Time-out occurs when the Rx FIFO is not empty, and no has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXIM
BitField.description: Software should set this bit to enable interrupt when the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full. The ARM spec implies that the preceding frame data is overwritten by the new frame data when this occurs.

BitField.name: RTRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, and has not been read for a time-out period. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full.

BitField.name: TXRIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if another frame was completely received while the RxFIFO was full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RTMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is not empty, has not been read for a time-out period, and this interrupt is enabled. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR X [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Rx FIFO is at least half full, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: TXMIS
BitField.description: This bit is 1 if the Tx FIFO is at least half empty, and this interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RORIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the frame was received when RxFIFO was full interrupt.

BitField.name: RTIC
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the Rx FIFO was not empty and has not been read for a time-out period interrupt. The time-out period is the same for master and slave modes and is determined by the SSP bit rate: 32 bits at PCLK / (CPSDVSR / [SCR+1]).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXDMAE
BitField.description: Receive DMA Enable. When this bit is set to one 1, DMA for the receive FIFO is enabled, otherwise receive DMA is disabled.

BitField.name: TXDMAE
BitField.description: Transmit DMA Enable. When this bit is set to one 1, DMA for the transmit FIFO is enabled, otherwise transmit DMA is disabled

BitField.name: RESERVED
