Enum.name: ERRORS
Enum.description: UARTn RBR contains at least one UARTn RX error.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCR
Register.description: Scratch Pad Register. 8-bit temporary storage for software.

BitField.name: PAD
BitField.description: A readable, writable byte.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: ACR
Register.description: Auto-baud Control Register. Contains controls for the auto-baud feature.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: Start bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

Enum.name: AUTO_BAUD_STOP_AUTO
Enum.description: Auto-baud stop (auto-baud is not running).

Enum.name: AUTO_BAUD_START_AUT
Enum.description: Auto-baud start (auto-baud is running). Auto-baud run bit. This bit is automatically cleared after auto-baud completion.

BitField.name: MODE
BitField.description: Auto-baud mode select bit.

Enum.name: MODE_0_
Enum.description: Mode 0.

Enum.name: MODE_1_
Enum.description: Mode 1.

BitField.name: AUTORESTART
BitField.description: Restart bit.

Enum.name: NO_RESTART_
Enum.description: No restart.

Enum.name: RESTART_IN_CASE_OF_T
Enum.description: Restart in case of time-out (counter restarts at next UARTn Rx falling edge)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: ABEOINTCLR
BitField.description: End of auto-baud interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_
Enum.description: No impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: ABTOINTCLR
BitField.description: Auto-baud time-out interrupt clear bit (write-only accessible). Writing a 1 will clear the corresponding interrupt in the UnIIR. Writing a 0 has no impact.

Enum.name: NO_IMPACT_
Enum.description: No impact.

Enum.name: CLEAR_THE_CORRESPOND
Enum.description: Clear the corresponding interrupt in the IIR.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FDR
Register.description: Fractional Divider Register. Generates a clock input for the baud rate divider.

BitField.name: DIVADDVAL
BitField.description: Baud-rate generation pre-scaler divisor value. If this field is 0, fractional baud-rate generator will not impact the UARTn baudrate.

BitField.name: MULVAL
BitField.description: Baud-rate pre-scaler multiplier value. This field must be greater or equal 1 for UARTn to operate properly, regardless of whether the fractional baud-rate generator is used or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: TER
Register.description: Transmit Enable Register. Turns off UART transmitter for use with software flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TXEN
BitField.description: When this bit is 1, as it is after a Reset, data written to the THR is output on the TXD pin as soon as any preceding data has been sent. If this bit is cleared to 0 while a character is being sent, the transmission of that character is completed, but no further characters are sent until this bit is set again. In other words, a 0 in this bit blocks the transfer of characters from the THR or TX FIFO into the transmit shift register. Software implementing software-handshaking can clear this bit when it receives an XOFF character (DC3). Software can set this bit again when it receives an XON (DC1) character.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485CTRL
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Control. Contains controls to configure various aspects of RS-485/EIA-485 modes.

BitField.name: NMMEN
BitField.description: NMM enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: RS-485/EIA-485 Normal Multidrop Mode (NMM) is enabled. In this mode, an address is detected when a received byte has the parity bit = 1, generating a received data interrupt. See Section 18.6.16 RS-485/EIA-485 modes of operation.

BitField.name: RXDIS
BitField.description: Receiver enable.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: The receiver is enabled.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: The receiver is disabled.

BitField.name: AADEN
BitField.description: AAD enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Auto Address Detect (AAD) is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Auto Address Detect (AAD) is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DCTRL
BitField.description: Direction control enable.

Enum.name: DISABLE_AUTO_DIRECTI
Enum.description: Disable Auto Direction Control.

Enum.name: ENABLE_AUTO_DIRECTIO
Enum.description: Enable Auto Direction Control.

BitField.name: OINV
BitField.description: Direction control pin polarity. This bit reverses the polarity of the direction control signal on the Un_OE pin.

Enum.name: DIRLOW
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 0 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 1 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

Enum.name: DIRHIGH
Enum.description: The direction control pin will be driven to logic 1 when the transmitter has data to be sent. It will be driven to logic 0 after the last bit of data has been transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: RS485ADRMATCH
Register.description: RS-485/EIA-485 address match. Contains the address match value for RS-485/EIA-485 mode.

BitField.name: ADRMATCH
BitField.description: Contains the address match value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DLY
BitField.description: Contains the direction control (UnOE) delay value. This register works in conjunction with an 8-bit counter.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CONSET
Register.description: I2C Control Set Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is set. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AA
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge flag.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: I2C interrupt flag.

BitField.name: STO
BitField.description: STOP flag.

BitField.name: STA
BitField.description: START flag.

BitField.name: I2EN
BitField.description: I2C interface enable.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: STAT
Register.description: I2C Status Register. During I2C operation, this register provides detailed status codes that allow software to determine the next action needed.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: These bits are unused and are always 0.

BitField.name: Status
BitField.description: These bits give the actual status information about the I 2C interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAT
Register.description: I2C Data Register. During master or slave transmit mode, data to be transmitted is written to this register. During master or slave receive mode, data that has been received may be read from this register.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds data values that have been received or are to be transmitted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR0
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register 0. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLH
Register.description: SCH Duty Cycle Register High Half Word. Determines the high time of the I2C clock.

BitField.name: SCLH
BitField.description: Count for SCL HIGH time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: SCLL
Register.description: SCL Duty Cycle Register Low Half Word. Determines the low time of the I2C clock. SCLL and SCLH together determine the clock frequency generated by an I2C master and certain times used in slave mode.

BitField.name: SCLL
BitField.description: Count for SCL low time period selection.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CONCLR
Register.description: I2C Control Clear Register. When a one is written to a bit of this register, the corresponding bit in the I2C control register is cleared. Writing a zero has no effect on the corresponding bit in the I2C control register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: AAC
BitField.description: Assert acknowledge Clear bit.

BitField.name: SIC
BitField.description: I2C interrupt Clear bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: STAC
BitField.description: START flag Clear bit.

BitField.name: I2ENC
BitField.description: I2C interface Disable bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MM_ENA
BitField.description: Monitor mode enable.

Enum.name: MONITOR_MODE_DISABLE
Enum.description: Monitor mode disabled.

Enum.name: THE_I_2C_MODULE_WILL
Enum.description: The I 2C module will enter monitor mode. In this mode the SDA output will be forced high. This will prevent the I2C module from outputting data of any kind (including ACK) onto the I2C data bus. Depending on the state of the ENA_SCL bit, the output may be also forced high, preventing the module from having control over the I2C clock line.

BitField.name: ENA_SCL
BitField.description: SCL output enable.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared to 0, the SCL output will be forced high when the module is in monitor mode. As described above, this will prevent the module from having any control over the I2C clock line.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set, the I2C module may exercise the same control over the clock line that it would in normal operation. This means that, acting as a slave peripheral, the I2C module can stretch the clock line (hold it low) until it has had time to respond to an I2C interrupt.[1]

BitField.name: MATCH_ALL
BitField.description: Select interrupt register match.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_CLE
Enum.description: When this bit is cleared, an interrupt will only be generated when a match occurs to one of the (up-to) four address registers described above. That is, the module will respond as a normal slave as far as address-recognition is concerned.

Enum.name: WHEN_THIS_BIT_IS_SET
Enum.description: When this bit is set to 1 and the I2C is in monitor mode, an interrupt will be generated on ANY address received. This will enable the part to monitor all traffic on the bus.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from reserved bits is not defined.

Register.name: ADR1
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR2
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: ADR3
Register.description: I2C Slave Address Register. Contains the 7-bit slave address for operation of the I2C interface in slave mode, and is not used in master mode. The least significant bit determines whether a slave responds to the General Call address.

BitField.name: GC
BitField.description: General Call enable bit.

BitField.name: Address
BitField.description: The I2C device address for slave mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DATA_BUFFER
Register.description: Data buffer register. The contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register will be transferred to the DATA_BUFFER automatically after every nine bits (8 bits of data plus ACK or NACK) has been received on the bus.

BitField.name: Data
BitField.description: This register holds contents of the 8 MSBs of the DAT shift register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. This bit reads always back as 0.

BitField.name: MASK
BitField.description: Mask bits.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAO
Register.description: I2S Digital Audio Output Register. Contains control bits for the I2S transmit channel.

BitField.name: WORDWIDTH
BitField.description: Selects the number of bytes in data as follows:

Enum.name: 8_BIT_DATA
Enum.description: 8-bit data

Enum.name: 16_BIT_DATA
Enum.description: 16-bit data

Enum.name: 32_BIT_DATA
Enum.description: 32-bit data

BitField.name: MONO
BitField.description: When 1, data is of monaural format. When 0, the data is in stereo format.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: When 1, disables accesses on FIFOs, places the transmit channel in mute mode.

BitField.name: RESET
BitField.description: When 1, asynchronously resets the transmit channel and FIFO.

BitField.name: WS_SEL
BitField.description: When 0, the interface is in master mode. When 1, the interface is in slave mode. See Section 34.7.2 for a summary of useful combinations for this bit with TXMODE.

BitField.name: WS_HALFPERIOD
BitField.description: Word select half period minus 1, i.e. WS 64clk period -> ws_halfperiod = 31.

BitField.name: MUTE
BitField.description: When 1, the transmit channel sends only zeroes.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DAI
Register.description: I2S Digital Audio Input Register. Contains control bits for the I2S receive channel.

BitField.name: WORDWIDTH
BitField.description: Selects the number of bytes in data as follows:

Enum.name: 8_BIT_DATA
Enum.description: 8-bit data

Enum.name: 16_BIT_DATA
Enum.description: 16-bit data

Enum.name: 32_BIT_DATA
Enum.description: 32-bit data

BitField.name: MONO
BitField.description: When 1, data is of monaural format. When 0, the data is in stereo format.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: When 1, disables accesses on FIFOs, places the transmit channel in mute mode.

BitField.name: RESET
BitField.description: When 1, asynchronously reset the transmit channel and FIFO.

BitField.name: WS_SEL
BitField.description: When 0, the interface is in master mode. When 1, the interface is in slave mode. See Section 34.7.2 for a summary of useful combinations for this bit with RXMODE.

BitField.name: WS_HALFPERIOD
BitField.description: Word select half period minus 1, i.e. WS 64clk period -> ws_halfperiod = 31.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TXFIFO
Register.description: I2S Transmit FIFO. Access register for the 8 x 32-bit transmitter FIFO.

BitField.name: I2STXFIFO
BitField.description: 8 x 32-bit transmit FIFO.

Register.name: RXFIFO
Register.description: I2S Receive FIFO. Access register for the 8 x 32-bit receiver FIFO.

BitField.name: I2SRXFIFO
BitField.description: 8 x 32-bit transmit FIFO.

Register.name: STATE
Register.description: I2S Status Feedback Register. Contains status information about the I2S interface.

BitField.name: IRQ
BitField.description: This bit reflects the presence of Receive Interrupt or Transmit Interrupt. This is determined by comparing the current FIFO levels to the rx_depth_irq and tx_depth_irq fields in the IRQ register.

BitField.name: DMAREQ1
BitField.description: This bit reflects the presence of Receive or Transmit DMA Request 1. This is determined by comparing the current FIFO levels to the rx_depth_dma1 and tx_depth_dma1 fields in the DMA1 register.

BitField.name: DMAREQ2
BitField.description: This bit reflects the presence of Receive or Transmit DMA Request 2. This is determined by comparing the current FIFO levels to the rx_depth_dma2 and tx_depth_dma2 fields in the DMA2 register.

BitField.name: RX_LEVEL
BitField.description: Reflects the current level of the Receive FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_LEVEL
BitField.description: Reflects the current level of the Transmit FIFO.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DMA1
Register.description: I2S DMA Configuration Register 1. Contains control information for DMA request 1.

BitField.name: RX_DMA1_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S receive.

BitField.name: TX_DMA1_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S transmit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RX_DEPTH_DMA1
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a receive DMA request on DMA1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DEPTH_DMA1
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a transmit DMA request on DMA1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: DMA2
Register.description: I2S DMA Configuration Register 2. Contains control information for DMA request 2.

BitField.name: RX_DMA2_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S receive.

BitField.name: TX_DMA2_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables DMA1 for I2S transmit.

BitField.name: RX_DEPTH_DMA2
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a receive DMA request on DMA2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DEPTH_DMA2
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level that triggers a transmit DMA request on DMA2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: IRQ
Register.description: I2S Interrupt Request Control Register. Contains bits that control how the I2S interrupt request is generated.

BitField.name: RX_IRQ_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables I2S receive interrupt.

BitField.name: TX_IRQ_ENABLE
BitField.description: When 1, enables I2S transmit interrupt.

BitField.name: RX_DEPTH_IRQ
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level on which to create an irq request.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TX_DEPTH_IRQ
BitField.description: Set the FIFO level on which to create an irq request.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TXRATE
Register.description: I2S Transmit MCLK divider. This register determines the I2S TX MCLK rate by specifying the value to divide PCLK by in order to produce MCLK.

BitField.name: Y_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S transmit MCLK rate denominator. This value is used to divide PCLK to produce the transmit MCLK. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. A value of 0 stops the clock.

BitField.name: X_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S transmit MCLK rate numerator. This value is used to multiply PCLK by to produce the transmit MCLK. A value of 0 stops the clock. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. Note: the resulting ratio X/Y is divided by 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RXRATE
Register.description: I2S Receive MCLK divider. This register determines the I2S RX MCLK rate by specifying the value to divide PCLK by in order to produce MCLK.

BitField.name: Y_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S receive MCLK rate denominator. This value is used to divide PCLK to produce the receive MCLK. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. A value of 0 stops the clock.

BitField.name: X_DIVIDER
BitField.description: I2S receive MCLK rate numerator. This value is used to multiply PCLK by to produce the receive MCLK. A value of 0 stops the clock. Eight bits of fractional divide supports a wide range of possibilities. Note: the resulting ratio X/Y is divided by 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: TXBITRATE
Register.description: I2S Transmit bit rate divider. This register determines the I2S transmit bit rate by specifying the value to divide TX_MCLK by in order to produce the transmit bit clock.

BitField.name: TX_BITRATE
BitField.description: I2S transmit bit rate. This value plus one is used to divide TX_MCLK to produce the transmit bit clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: RXBITRATE
Register.description: I2S Receive bit rate divider. This register determines the I2S receive bit rate by specifying the value to divide RX_MCLK by in order to produce the receive bit clock.

BitField.name: RX_BITRATE
BitField.description: I2S receive bit rate. This value plus one is used to divide RX_MCLK to produce the receive bit clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: TXCLKSEL
BitField.description: Clock source selection for the transmit bit clock divider.

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_TX_FRACTI
Enum.description: Select the TX fractional rate divider clock output as the source

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_RX_MCLK_S
Enum.description: Select the RX_MCLK signal as the TX_MCLK clock source

BitField.name: TX4PIN
BitField.description: Transmit 4-pin mode selection. When 1, enables 4-pin mode.

BitField.name: TXMCENA
BitField.description: Enable for the TX_MCLK output. When 0, output of TX_MCLK is not enabled. When 1, output of TX_MCLK is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXCLKSEL
BitField.description: Clock source selection for the receive bit clock divider.

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_RX_FRACTI
Enum.description: Select the RX fractional rate divider clock output as the source

Enum.name: SELECT_THE_TX_MCLK_S
Enum.description: Select the TX_MCLK signal as the RX_MCLK clock source

BitField.name: RX4PIN
BitField.description: Receive 4-pin mode selection. When 1, enables 4-pin mode.

BitField.name: RXMCENA
BitField.description: Enable for the RX_MCLK output. When 0, output of RX_MCLK is not enabled. When 1, output of RX_MCLK is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RICOMP
BitField.description: Compare register. Holds the compare value which is compared to the counter.

Register.name: MASK
Register.description: Mask register. This register holds the 32-bit mask value. A 1 written to any bit will force a compare on the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register.

BitField.name: RIMASK
BitField.description: Mask register. This register holds the 32-bit mask value. A one written to any bit overrides the result of the comparison for the corresponding bit of the counter and compare register (causes the comparison of the register bits to be always true).

BitField.name: RITINT
BitField.description: Interrupt flag

Enum.name: THIS_BIT_IS_SET_TO_1
Enum.description: This bit is set to 1 by hardware whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of RICOMPVAL and RIMASK registers. Writing a 1 to this bit will clear it to 0. Writing a 0 has no effect.

Enum.name: THE_COUNTER_VALUE_DO
Enum.description: The counter value does not equal the masked compare value.

BitField.name: RITENCLR
BitField.description: Timer enable clear

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_WILL_BE_CL
Enum.description: The timer will be cleared to 0 whenever the counter value equals the masked compare value specified by the contents of RICOMPVAL and RIMASK registers. This will occur on the same clock that sets the interrupt flag.

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_WILL_NOT_B
Enum.description: The timer will not be cleared to 0.

BitField.name: RITENBR
BitField.description: Timer enable for debug

Enum.name: THE_TIMER_IS_HALTED_
Enum.description: The timer is halted when the processor is halted for debugging.

Enum.name: DEBUG_HAS_NO_EFFECT_
Enum.description: Debug has no effect on the timer operation.

BitField.name: RITEN
BitField.description: Timer enable.

Enum.name: TIMER_ENABLED_THIS_
Enum.description: Timer enabled. This can be overruled by a debug halt if enabled in bit 2.

Enum.name: TIMER_DISABLED_
Enum.description: Timer disabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RICOUNTER
BitField.description: 32-bit up counter. Counts continuously unless RITEN bit in RICTRL register is cleared or debug mode is entered (if enabled by the RITNEBR bit in RICTRL). Can be loaded to any value in software.

BitField.name: RUN0
BitField.description: Stops/starts timer channel 0.

BitField.name: CENTER0
BitField.description: Edge/center aligned operation for channel 0.

BitField.name: POLA0
BitField.description: Selects polarity of the MCOA0 and MCOB0 pins.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_LOW
Enum.description: Passive state is LOW, active state is HIGH.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_HIG
Enum.description: Passive state is HIGH, active state is LOW.

BitField.name: DTE0
BitField.description: Controls the dead-time feature for channel 0.

Enum.name: DEAD_TIME_DISABLED_
Enum.description: Dead-time disabled.

Enum.name: DEAD_TIME_ENABLED_
Enum.description: Dead-time enabled.

BitField.name: DISUP0
BitField.description: Enable/disable updates of functional registers for channel 0 (see Section 24.8.2).

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers are updated from the write registers at the end of each PWM cycle.

Enum.name: NOUPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers remain the same as long as the timer is running.

BitField.name: RUN1
BitField.description: Stops/starts timer channel 1.

BitField.name: CENTER1
BitField.description: Edge/center aligned operation for channel 1.

BitField.name: POLA1
BitField.description: Selects polarity of the MCOA1 and MCOB1 pins.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_LOW
Enum.description: Passive state is LOW, active state is HIGH.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_HIG
Enum.description: Passive state is HIGH, active state is LOW.

BitField.name: DTE1
BitField.description: Controls the dead-time feature for channel 1.

Enum.name: DEAD_TIME_DISABLED_
Enum.description: Dead-time disabled.

Enum.name: DEAD_TIME_ENABLED_
Enum.description: Dead-time enabled.

BitField.name: DISUP1
BitField.description: Enable/disable updates of functional registers for channel 1 (see Section 24.8.2).

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers are updated from the write registers at the end of each PWM cycle.

Enum.name: NOUPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers remain the same as long as the timer is running.

BitField.name: RUN2
BitField.description: Stops/starts timer channel 2.

BitField.name: CENTER2
BitField.description: Edge/center aligned operation for channel 2.

BitField.name: POLA2
BitField.description: Selects polarity of the MCOA2 and MCOB2 pins.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_LOW
Enum.description: Passive state is LOW, active state is HIGH.

Enum.name: PASSIVE_STATE_IS_HIG
Enum.description: Passive state is HIGH, active state is LOW.

BitField.name: DTE2
BitField.description: Controls the dead-time feature for channel 1.

Enum.name: DEAD_TIME_DISABLED_
Enum.description: Dead-time disabled.

Enum.name: DEAD_TIME_ENABLED_
Enum.description: Dead-time enabled.

BitField.name: DISUP2
BitField.description: Enable/disable updates of functional registers for channel 2 (see Section 24.8.2).

Enum.name: UPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers are updated from the write registers at the end of each PWM cycle.

Enum.name: NOUPDATE
Enum.description: Functional registers remain the same as long as the timer is running.

BitField.name: INVBDC
BitField.description: Controls the polarity of the MCOB outputs for all 3 channels. This bit is typically set to 1 only in 3-phase DC mode.

Enum.name: OPPOSITE
Enum.description: The MCOB outputs have opposite polarity from the MCOA outputs (aside from dead time).

Enum.name: SAME
Enum.description: The MCOB outputs have the same basic polarity as the MCOA outputs. (see Section 24.8.6)

BitField.name: ACMODE
BitField.description: 3-phase AC mode select (see Section 24.8.7).

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_AC_MODE_OFF
Enum.description: 3-phase AC-mode off: Each PWM channel uses its own timer-counter and period register.

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_AC_MODE_ON_
Enum.description: 3-phase AC-mode on: All PWM channels use the timer-counter and period register of channel 0.

BitField.name: DCMODE
BitField.description: 3-phase DC mode select (see Section 24.8.6).

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_DC_MODE_OFF
Enum.description: 3-phase DC mode off: PWM channels are independent (unless bit ACMODE = 1)

Enum.name: 3_PHASE_DC_MODE_ON_
Enum.description: 3-phase DC mode on: The internal MCOA0 output is routed through the CP register (i.e. a mask) register to all six PWM outputs.

BitField.description: A 1 in this bit enables a channel 0 capture event on a falling edge on MCI0.

BitField.name: CAP0MCI1_FE

BitField.name: CAP_CLR0
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CAP0 register.

BitField.name: CAP_CLR1
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CAP1 register.

BitField.name: CAP_CLR2
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the CAP2 register.

BitField.name: RESP
BitField.description: Reset position counter. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros. Autoclears when the position counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESPI
BitField.description: Reset position counter on index. When set = 1, resets the position counter to all zeros once only the first time an index pulse occurs. Autoclears when the position counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESV
BitField.description: Reset velocity. When set = 1, resets the velocity counter to all zeros, reloads the velocity timer, and presets the velocity compare register. Autoclears when the velocity counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESI
BitField.description: Reset index counter. When set = 1, resets the index counter to all zeros. Autoclears when the index counter is cleared.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DIRINV
BitField.description: Direction invert. When 1, complements the DIR bit.

BitField.name: SIGMODE
BitField.description: Signal Mode. When 0, PhA and PhB function as quadrature encoder inputs. When 1, PhA functions as the direction signal and PhB functions as the clock signal.

BitField.name: CAPMODE
BitField.description: Capture Mode. When 0, only PhA edges are counted (2X). When 1, BOTH PhA and PhB edges are counted (4X), increasing resolution but decreasing range.

BitField.name: INVINX
BitField.description: Invert Index. When 1, inverts the sense of the index input.

BitField.name: CRESPI
BitField.description: Continuously reset the position counter on index. When 1, resets the position counter to all zeros whenever an index pulse occurs after the next position increase (recalibration).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INXGATE
BitField.description: Index gating configuration: When INXGATE[16] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 1 and PHB = 0, otherwise block index. When INXGATE[17] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 1 and PHB = 1, otherwise block index. When INXGATE[18] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 0 and PHB = 1, otherwise block index. When INXGATE[19] = 1, pass the index when PHA = 0 and PHB = 0, otherwise block index.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DIR
BitField.description: Direction bit. In combination with DIRINV bit indicates forward or reverse direction. See Table 597.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: POS
BitField.description: Current position value.

BitField.name: MAXPOS
BitField.description: Current maximum position value.

BitField.name: PCMP0
BitField.description: Position compare value 0.

BitField.name: PCMP1
BitField.description: Position compare value 1.

BitField.name: PCMP2
BitField.description: Position compare value 2.

BitField.name: ENCPOS
BitField.description: Current index counter value.

BitField.name: ICMP0
BitField.description: Index compare value 0.

BitField.name: VELLOAD
BitField.description: Current velocity timer load value.

BitField.name: VELVAL
BitField.description: Current velocity timer value.

BitField.name: VELPC
BitField.description: Current velocity pulse count.

BitField.name: VELCAP
BitField.description: Last velocity capture.

BitField.name: VELPC
BitField.description: Compare velocity pulse count.

BitField.name: FILTA
BitField.description: Digital filter sampling delay.

BitField.name: INX_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that an index pulse was detected.

BitField.name: TIM_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that a velocity timer overflow occurred

BitField.name: VELC_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that captured velocity is less than compare velocity.

BitField.name: DIR_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that a change of direction was detected.

BitField.name: ERR_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that an encoder phase error was detected.

BitField.name: ENCLK_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that and encoder clock pulse was detected.

BitField.name: POS0_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the position 0 compare value is equal to the current position.

BitField.name: POS1_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the position 1compare value is equal to the current position.

BitField.name: POS2_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the position 2 compare value is equal to the current position.

BitField.name: REV0_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the index compare 0 value is equal to the current index count.

BitField.name: POS0REV_INT
BitField.description: Combined position 0 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS0_Int bit is set and the REV0_Int is set.

BitField.name: POS1REV_INT
BitField.description: Combined position 1 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS1_Int bit is set and the REV1_Int is set.

BitField.name: POS2REV_INT
BitField.description: Combined position 2 and revolution count interrupt. Set when both the POS2_Int bit is set and the REV2_Int is set.

BitField.name: REV1_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the index compare 1value is equal to the current index count.

BitField.name: REV2_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the index compare 2 value is equal to the current index count.

BitField.name: MAXPOS_INT
BitField.description: Indicates that the current position count goes through the MAXPOS value to zero in the forward direction, or through zero to MAXPOS in the reverse direction.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.description: When 1, the MAXPOS_Int interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: FLASHCFG
Register.description: Flash Accelerator Configuration Register. Controls flash access timing.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not change these bits from the reset value.

BitField.name: FLASHTIM
BitField.description: Flash access time. The value of this field plus 1 gives the number of CPU clocks used for a flash access. Warning: improper setting of this value may result in incorrect operation of the device. Other values are reserved.

Enum.name: 1CLK
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 1 CPU clock. Use for up to 20 MHz CPU clock.

Enum.name: 2CLK
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 2 CPU clocks. Use for up to 40 MHz CPU clock.

Enum.name: 3CLK
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 3 CPU clocks. Use for up to 60 MHz CPU clock.

Enum.name: 4CLK
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 4 CPU clocks. Use for up to 80 MHz CPU clock.

Enum.name: 5CLK
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 5 CPU clocks. Use for up to 100 MHz CPU clock. Use for up to 120 Mhz for LPC1759 and LPC1769 only.

Enum.name: 6CLK
Enum.description: Flash accesses use 6 CPU clocks. This safe setting will work under any conditions.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLLE0
BitField.description: PLL0 Enable. When one, and after a valid PLL0 feed, this bit will activate PLL0 and allow it to lock to the requested frequency. See PLL0STAT register.

BitField.name: PLLC0
BitField.description: PLL0 Connect. Setting PLLC0 to one after PLL0 has been enabled and locked, then followed by a valid PLL0 feed sequence causes PLL0 to become the clock source for the CPU, AHB peripherals, and used to derive the clocks for APB peripherals. The PLL0 output may potentially be used to clock the USB subsystem if the frequency is 48 MHz. See PLL0STAT register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MSEL0
BitField.description: PLL0 Multiplier value. Supplies the value M in PLL0 frequency calculations. The value stored here is M - 1. Note: Not all values of M are needed, and therefore some are not supported by hardware.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: NSEL0
BitField.description: PLL0 Pre-Divider value. Supplies the value N in PLL0 frequency calculations. The value stored here is N - 1. Supported values for N are 1 through 32.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MSEL0
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL0 Multiplier value. This is the value currently used by PLL0, and is one less than the actual multiplier.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: NSEL0
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL0 Pre-Divider value. This is the value currently used by PLL0, and is one less than the actual divider.

BitField.name: PLLE0_STAT
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL0 Enable bit. This bit reflects the state of the PLEC0 bit in PLL0CON after a valid PLL0 feed. When one, PLL0 is currently enabled. When zero, PLL0 is turned off. This bit is automatically cleared when Power-down mode is entered.

BitField.name: PLLC0_STAT
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL0 Connect bit. This bit reflects the state of the PLLC0 bit in PLL0CON after a valid PLL0 feed. When PLLC0 and PLLE0 are both one, PLL0 is connected as the clock source for the CPU. When either PLLC0 or PLLE0 is zero, PLL0 is bypassed. This bit is automatically cleared when Power-down mode is entered.

BitField.name: PLOCK0
BitField.description: Reflects the PLL0 Lock status. When zero, PLL0 is not locked. When one, PLL0 is locked onto the requested frequency. See text for details.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLL0FEED
BitField.description: The PLL0 feed sequence must be written to this register in order for PLL0 configuration and control register changes to take effect.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLLE1
BitField.description: PLL1 Enable. When one, and after a valid PLL1 feed, this bit will activate PLL1 and allow it to lock to the requested frequency.

BitField.name: PLLC1
BitField.description: PLL1 Connect. Setting PLLC to one after PLL1 has been enabled and locked, then followed by a valid PLL1 feed sequence causes PLL1 to become the clock source for the USB subsystem via the USB clock divider. See PLL1STAT register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MSEL1
BitField.description: PLL1 Multiplier value. Supplies the value M in the PLL1 frequency calculations.

BitField.name: PSEL1
BitField.description: PLL1 Divider value. Supplies the value P in the PLL1 frequency calculations.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: MSEL1
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL1 Multiplier value. This is the value currently used by PLL1.

BitField.name: PSEL1
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL1 Divider value. This is the value currently used by PLL1.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLLE1_STAT
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL1 Enable bit. When one, PLL1 is currently activated. When zero, PLL1 is turned off. This bit is automatically cleared when Power-down mode is activated.

BitField.name: PLLC1_STAT
BitField.description: Read-back for the PLL1 Connect bit. When PLLC and PLLE are both one, PLL1 is connected as the clock source for the microcontroller. When either PLLC or PLLE is zero, PLL1 is bypassed and the oscillator clock is used directly by the microcontroller. This bit is automatically cleared when Power-down mode is activated.

BitField.name: PLOCK1
BitField.description: Reflects the PLL1 Lock status. When zero, PLL1 is not locked. When one, PLL1 is locked onto the requested frequency.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PLL1FEED
BitField.description: The PLL1 feed sequence must be written to this register in order for PLL1 configuration and control register changes to take effect.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PM0
BitField.description: Power mode control bit 0. This bit controls entry to the Power-down mode.

BitField.name: PM1
BitField.description: Power mode control bit 1. This bit controls entry to the Deep Power-down mode.

BitField.name: BODRPM
BitField.description: Brown-Out Reduced Power Mode. When BODRPM is 1, the Brown-Out Detect circuitry will be turned off when chip Power-down mode or Deep Sleep mode is entered, resulting in a further reduction in power usage. However, the possibility of using Brown-Out Detect as a wake-up source from the reduced power mode will be lost. When 0, the Brown-Out Detect function remains active during Power-down and Deep Sleep modes. See the System Control Block chapter for details of Brown-Out detection.

BitField.name: BOGD
BitField.description: Brown-Out Global Disable. When BOGD is 1, the Brown-Out Detect circuitry is fully disabled at all times, and does not consume power. When 0, the Brown-Out Detect circuitry is enabled. See the System Control Block chapter for details of Brown-Out detection. Note: the Brown-Out Reset Disable (BORD, in this register) and the Brown-Out Interrupt (xx) must be disabled when software changes the value of this bit.

BitField.name: BORD
BitField.description: Brown-Out Reset Disable. When BORD is 1, the BOD will not reset the device when the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage dips goes below the BOD reset trip level. The Brown-Out interrupt is not affected. When BORD is 0, the BOD reset is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: SMFLAG
BitField.description: Sleep Mode entry flag. Set when the Sleep mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: DSFLAG
BitField.description: Deep Sleep entry flag. Set when the Deep Sleep mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: PDFLAG
BitField.description: Power-down entry flag. Set when the Power-down mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: DPDFLAG
BitField.description: Deep Power-down entry flag. Set when the Deep Power-down mode is successfully entered. Cleared by software writing a one to this bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PCTIM0
BitField.description: Timer/Counter 0 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM1
BitField.description: Timer/Counter 1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART0
BitField.description: UART0 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART1
BitField.description: UART1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCPWM1
BitField.description: PWM1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2C0
BitField.description: The I2C0 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSPI
BitField.description: The SPI interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCRTC
BitField.description: The RTC power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSSP1
BitField.description: The SSP 1 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCADC
BitField.description: A/D converter (ADC) power/clock control bit. Note: Clear the PDN bit in the AD0CR before clearing this bit, and set this bit before setting PDN.

BitField.name: PCCAN1
BitField.description: CAN Controller 1 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCCAN2
BitField.description: CAN Controller 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCGPIO
BitField.description: Power/clock control bit for IOCON, GPIO, and GPIO interrupts.

BitField.name: PCRIT
BitField.description: Repetitive Interrupt Timer power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCMCPWM
BitField.description: Motor Control PWM

BitField.name: PCQEI
BitField.description: Quadrature Encoder Interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2C1
BitField.description: The I2C1 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCSSP0
BitField.description: The SSP0 interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM2
BitField.description: Timer 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCTIM3
BitField.description: Timer 3 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART2
BitField.description: UART 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUART3
BitField.description: UART 3 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2C2
BitField.description: I2C interface 2 power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCI2S
BitField.description: I2S interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCGPDMA
BitField.description: GPDMA function power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCENET
BitField.description: Ethernet block power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: PCUSB
BitField.description: USB interface power/clock control bit.

BitField.name: CCLKSEL
BitField.description: Selects the divide value for creating the CPU clock (CCLK) from the PLL0 output. 0 = pllclk is divided by 1 to produce the CPU clock. This setting is not allowed when the PLL0 is connected, because the rate would always be greater than the maximum allowed CPU clock. 1 = pllclk is divided by 2 to produce the CPU clock. This setting is not allowed when the PLL0 is connected, because the rate would always be greater than the maximum allowed CPU clock. 2 = pllclk is divided by 3 to produce the CPU clock. 3 = pllclk is divided by 4 to produce the CPU clock. ... 255 = pllclk is divided by 256 to produce the CPU clock.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: USBSEL
BitField.description: Selects the divide value for creating the USB clock from the PLL0 output. Only the values shown below can produce even number multiples of 48 MHz from the PLL0 output. Warning: Improper setting of this value will result in incorrect operation of the USB interface. 5 = PLL0 output is divided by 6. PLL0 output must be 288 MHz. 7 = PLL0 output is divided by 8. PLL0 output must be 384 MHz. 9 = PLL0 output is divided by 10. PLL0 output must be 480 MHz.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: CLKSRC
BitField.description: Selects the clock source for PLL0 as follows. Warning: Improper setting of this value, or an incorrect sequence of changing this value may result in incorrect operation of the device.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_INTERNAL
Enum.description: Selects the Internal RC oscillator as the PLL0 clock source (default).

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_MAIN_OSC
Enum.description: Selects the main oscillator as the PLL0 clock source. Select the main oscillator as PLL0 clock source if the PLL0 clock output is used for USB or for CAN with baudrates > 100 kBit/s.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_RTC_OSCI
Enum.description: Selects the RTC oscillator as the PLL0 clock source.

Enum.name: RESERVED
Enum.description: Reserved, do not use this setting.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: CANSLEEPCLR
Register.description: Allows clearing the current CAN channel sleep state as well as reading that state.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CAN1SLEEP
BitField.description: Sleep status and control for CAN channel 1. Read: when 1, indicates that CAN channel 1 is in the sleep mode. Write: writing a 1 causes clocks to be restored to CAN channel 1.

BitField.name: CAN2SLEEP
BitField.description: Sleep status and control for CAN channel 2. Read: when 1, indicates that CAN channel 2 is in the sleep mode. Write: writing a 1 causes clocks to be restored to CAN channel 2.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: CANWAKEFLAGS
Register.description: Allows reading the wake-up state of the CAN channels.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CAN1WAKE
BitField.description: Wake-up status for CAN channel 1. Read: when 1, indicates that a falling edge has occurred on the receive data line of CAN channel 1. Write: writing a 1 clears this bit.

BitField.name: CAN2WAKE
BitField.description: Wake-up status for CAN channel 2. Read: when 1, indicates that a falling edge has occurred on the receive data line of CAN channel 2. Write: writing a 1 clears this bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EINT0
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT0 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT0 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.

BitField.name: EINT1
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT1 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT1 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.

BitField.name: EINT2
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT2 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT2 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.

BitField.name: EINT3
BitField.description: In level-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT3 function is selected for its pin, and the pin is in its active state. In edge-sensitive mode, this bit is set if the EINT3 function is selected for its pin, and the selected edge occurs on the pin. This bit is cleared by writing a one to it, except in level sensitive mode when the pin is in its active state.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: EXTMODE0
BitField.description: External interrupt 0 EINT0 mode.

Enum.name: LEVEL_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Level-sensitive. Level-sensitivity is selected for EINT0.

Enum.name: EDGE_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Edge-sensitive. EINT0 is edge sensitive.

BitField.name: EXTMODE1
BitField.description: External interrupt 1 EINT1 mode.

Enum.name: LEVEL_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Level-sensitive. Level-sensitivity is selected for EINT1.

Enum.name: EDGE_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Edge-sensitive. EINT1 is edge sensitive.

BitField.name: EXTMODE2
BitField.description: External interrupt 2 EINT2 mode.

Enum.name: LEVEL_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Level-sensitive. Level-sensitivity is selected for EINT2.

Enum.name: EDGE_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Edge-sensitive. EINT2 is edge sensitive.

BitField.name: EXTMODE3
BitField.description: External interrupt 3 EINT3 mode.

Enum.name: LEVEL_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Level-sensitive. Level-sensitivity is selected for EINT3.

Enum.name: EDGE_SENSITIVE
Enum.description: Edge-sensitive. EINT3 is edge sensitive.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR0
BitField.description: External interrupt 0 EINT0 polarity.

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE
Enum.description: Falling edge. EINT0 is low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE0).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE
Enum.description: Rising edge. EINT0 is high-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE0).

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR1
BitField.description: External interrupt 1 EINT1 polarity.

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE
Enum.description: Falling edge. EINT1 is low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE1).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE
Enum.description: Rising edge. EINT1 is high-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE1).

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR2
BitField.description: External interrupt 2 EINT2 polarity.

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE
Enum.description: Falling edge. EINT2 is low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE2).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE
Enum.description: Rising edge. EINT2 is high-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE2).

BitField.name: EXTPOLAR3
BitField.description: External interrupt 3 EINT3 polarity.

Enum.name: FALLING_EDGE
Enum.description: Falling edge. EINT3 is low-active or falling-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE3).

Enum.name: RISING_EDGE
Enum.description: Rising edge. EINT3 is high-active or rising-edge sensitive (depending on EXTMODE3).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: POR
BitField.description: Assertion of the POR signal sets this bit, and clears all of the other bits in this register. But if another Reset signal (e.g., External Reset) remains asserted after the POR signal is negated, then its bit is set. This bit is not affected by any of the other sources of Reset.

BitField.name: EXTR
BitField.description: Assertion of the RESET signal sets this bit. This bit is cleared only by software or POR.

BitField.name: WDTR
BitField.description: This bit is set when the Watchdog Timer times out and the WDTRESET bit in the Watchdog Mode Register is 1. This bit is cleared only by software or POR.

BitField.name: BODR
BitField.description: This bit is set when the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage reaches a level below the BOD reset trip level (typically 1.85 V under nominal room temperature conditions). If the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage dips from the normal operating range to below the BOD reset trip level and recovers, the BODR bit will be set to 1. If the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage dips from the normal operating range to below the BOD reset trip level and continues to decline to the level at which POR is asserted (nominally 1 V), the BODR bit is cleared. If the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage rises continuously from below 1 V to a level above the BOD reset trip level, the BODR will be set to 1. This bit is cleared only by software or POR. Note: Only in the case where a reset occurs and the POR = 0, the BODR bit indicates if the VDD(REG)(3V3) voltage was below the BOD reset trip level or not.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: OSCRANGE
BitField.description: Main oscillator range select.

Enum.name: LOW
Enum.description: Low. The frequency range of the main oscillator is 1 MHz to 20 MHz.

Enum.name: HIGH
Enum.description: High. The frequency range of the main oscillator is 15 MHz to 25 MHz.

BitField.name: OSCEN
BitField.description: Main oscillator enable.

Enum.name: DISABLED
Enum.description: Disabled. The main oscillator is disabled.

Enum.name: ENABLED
Enum.description: Enabled.The main oscillator is enabled, and will start up if the correct external circuitry is connected to the XTAL1 and XTAL2 pins.

BitField.name: OSCSTAT
BitField.description: Main oscillator status.

Enum.name: NOT_READY
Enum.description: Not ready. The main oscillator is not ready to be used as a clock source.

Enum.name: READY
Enum.description: Ready. The main oscillator is ready to be used as a clock source. The main oscillator must be enabled via the OSCEN bit.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. User software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PCLK_WDT
BitField.description: Peripheral clock selection for WDT.

Enum.name: CCLK_DIV_4
Enum.description: CCLK div 4. PCLK_peripheral = CCLK/4

Enum.name: CCLK
Enum.description: CCLK. PCLK_peripheral = CCLK

Enum.name: CCLK_DIV_2
Enum.description: CCLK div 2. PCLK_peripheral = CCLK/2

Enum.name: CCLK_DIV_8
Enum.description: CCLK div 8. PCLK_peripheral = CCLK/8

BitField.name: PCLK_TIMER0
BitField.description: Peripheral clock selection for TIMER0.

Enum.name: CCLK_DIV_4
Enum.description: CCLK div 4. PCLK_peripheral = CCLK/4
