BitField.name: USB_INT_REQ_LP
BitField.description: Low priority interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_INT_REQ_HP
BitField.description: High priority interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_INT_REQ_DMA
BitField.description: DMA interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_HOST_INT
BitField.description: USB host interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_ATX_INT
BitField.description: External ATX interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_OTG_INT
BitField.description: OTG interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: USB_I2C_INT
BitField.description: I2C module interrupt line status. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: USB_NEED_CLK
BitField.description: USB need clock indicator. This bit is read-only. This bit is set to 1 when USB activity or a change of state on the USB data pins is detected, and it indicates that a PLL supplied clock of 48 MHz is needed. Once USB_NEED_CLK becomes one, it resets to zero 5 ms after the last packet has been received/sent, or 2 ms after the Suspend Change (SUS_CH) interrupt has occurred. A change of this bit from 0 to 1 can wake up the microcontroller if activity on the USB bus is selected to wake up the part from the Power-down mode (see Section 4.7.9 Wake-up from Reduced Power Modes for details). Also see Section 4.5.8 PLLs and Power-down mode and Section 4.7.10 Power Control for Peripherals register (PCONP - 0x400F C0C4) for considerations about the PLL and invoking the Power-down mode. This bit is read-only.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: EN_USB_INTS
BitField.description: Enable all USB interrupts. When this bit is cleared, the NVIC does not see the ORed output of the USB interrupt lines.

Register.name: DMACREQSEL
Register.description: Selects between alternative requests on DMA channels 0 through 7 and 10 through 15

BitField.name: DMASEL08
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 8: 0 - uart0 tx 1 - Timer 0 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL09
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 9: 0 - uart0 rx 1 - Timer 0 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL10
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 10: 0 - uart1 tx is selected. 1 - Timer 1 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL11
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 11: 0 - uart1 rx is selected. 1 - Timer 1 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL12
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 12: 0 - uart2 tx is selected. 1 - Timer 2 match 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL13
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 13: 0 - uart2 rx is selected. 1 - Timer 2 match 1 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL14
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 14: 0 - uart3 tx is selected. 1 - I2S channel 0 is selected.

BitField.name: DMASEL15
BitField.description: Selects the DMA request for GPDMA input 15: 0 - uart3 rx is selected. 1 - I2S channel 1 is selected.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CLKOUTSEL
BitField.description: Selects the clock source for the CLKOUT function. Other values are reserved. Do not use.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_CPU_CLOC
Enum.description: Selects the CPU clock as the CLKOUT source.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_MAIN_OSC
Enum.description: Selects the main oscillator as the CLKOUT source.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_INTERNAL
Enum.description: Selects the Internal RC oscillator as the CLKOUT source.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_USB_CLOC
Enum.description: Selects the USB clock as the CLKOUT source.

Enum.name: SELECTS_THE_RTC_OSCI
Enum.description: Selects the RTC oscillator as the CLKOUT source.

BitField.name: CLKOUTDIV
BitField.description: Integer value to divide the output clock by, minus one. 0 = Clock is divided by 1 1 = Clock is divided by 2. 2 = Clock is divided by 3. ... 15 = Clock is divided by 16.

BitField.name: CLKOUT_EN
BitField.description: CLKOUT enable control, allows switching the CLKOUT source without glitches. Clear to stop CLKOUT on the next falling edge. Set to enable CLKOUT.

BitField.name: CLKOUT_ACT
BitField.description: CLKOUT activity indication. Reads as 1 when CLKOUT is enabled. Read as 0 when CLKOUT has been disabled via the CLKOUT_EN bit and the clock has completed being stopped.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, user software should not write ones to reserved bits. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RXENABLE
BitField.description: RECEIVE ENABLE. Set this to allow receive frames to be received. Internally the MAC synchronizes this control bit to the incoming receive stream.

BitField.name: PARF
BitField.description: PASS ALL RECEIVE FRAMES. When enabled (set to 1), the MAC will pass all frames regardless of type (normal vs. Control). When disabled, the MAC does not pass valid Control frames.

BitField.name: RXFLOWCTRL
BitField.description: RX FLOW CONTROL. When enabled (set to 1), the MAC acts upon received PAUSE Flow Control frames. When disabled, received PAUSE Flow Control frames are ignored.

BitField.name: TXFLOWCTRL
BitField.description: TX FLOW CONTROL. When enabled (set to 1), PAUSE Flow Control frames are allowed to be transmitted. When disabled, Flow Control frames are blocked.

BitField.name: LOOPBACK
BitField.description: Setting this bit will cause the MAC Transmit interface to be looped back to the MAC Receive interface. Clearing this bit results in normal operation.

BitField.name: RESETTX
BitField.description: Setting this bit will put the Transmit Function logic in reset.

BitField.name: RESETMCSTX
BitField.description: Setting this bit resets the MAC Control Sublayer / Transmit logic. The MCS logic implements flow control.

BitField.name: RESETRX
BitField.description: Setting this bit will put the Ethernet receive logic in reset.

BitField.name: RESETMCSRX
BitField.description: Setting this bit resets the MAC Control Sublayer / Receive logic. The MCS logic implements flow control.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: SIMRESET
BitField.description: SIMULATION RESET. Setting this bit will cause a reset to the random number generator within the Transmit Function.

BitField.name: SOFTRESET
BitField.description: SOFT RESET. Setting this bit will put all modules within the MAC in reset except the Host Interface.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: FULLDUPLEX
BitField.description: When enabled (set to 1), the MAC operates in Full-Duplex mode. When disabled, the MAC operates in Half-Duplex mode.

BitField.name: FLC
BitField.description: FRAMELENGTH CHECKING. When enabled (set to 1), both transmit and receive frame lengths are compared to the Length/Type field. If the Length/Type field represents a length then the check is performed. Mismatches are reported in the StatusInfo word for each received frame.

BitField.name: HFEN
BitField.description: HUGE FRAME ENABLEWhen enabled (set to 1), frames of any length are transmitted and received.

BitField.name: DELAYEDCRC
BitField.description: DELAYED CRC. This bit determines the number of bytes, if any, of proprietary header information that exist on the front of IEEE 802.3 frames. When 1, four bytes of header (ignored by the CRC function) are added. When 0, there is no proprietary header.

BitField.name: CRCEN
BitField.description: CRC ENABLESet this bit to append a CRC to every frame whether padding was required or not. Must be set if PAD/CRC ENABLE is set. Clear this bit if frames presented to the MAC contain a CRC.

BitField.name: PADCRCEN
BitField.description: PAD CRC ENABLE. Set this bit to have the MAC pad all short frames. Clear this bit if frames presented to the MAC have a valid length. This bit is used in conjunction with AUTO PAD ENABLE and VLAN PAD ENABLE. See Table 153 - Pad Operation for details on the pad function.

BitField.name: VLANPADEN
BitField.description: VLAN PAD ENABLE. Set this bit to cause the MAC to pad all short frames to 64 bytes and append a valid CRC. Consult Table 153 - Pad Operation for more information on the various padding features. Note: This bit is ignored if PAD / CRC ENABLE is cleared.

BitField.name: AUTODETPADEN
BitField.description: AUTODETECTPAD ENABLE. Set this bit to cause the MAC to automatically detect the type of frame, either tagged or un-tagged, by comparing the two octets following the source address with 0x8100 (VLAN Protocol ID) and pad accordingly. Table 153 - Pad Operation provides a description of the pad function based on the configuration of this register. Note: This bit is ignored if PAD / CRC ENABLE is cleared.

BitField.name: PPENF
BitField.description: PURE PREAMBLE ENFORCEMEN. When enabled (set to 1), the MAC will verify the content of the preamble to ensure it contains 0x55 and is error-free. A packet with an incorrect preamble is discarded. When disabled, no preamble checking is performed.

BitField.name: LPENF
BitField.description: LONG PREAMBLE ENFORCEMENT. When enabled (set to 1), the MAC only allows receive packets which contain preamble fields less than 12 bytes in length. When disabled, the MAC allows any length preamble as per the Standard.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: NOBACKOFF
BitField.description: When enabled (set to 1), the MAC will immediately retransmit following a collision rather than using the Binary Exponential Backoff algorithm as specified in the Standard.

BitField.name: BP_NOBACKOFF
BitField.description: BACK PRESSURE / NO BACKOFF. When enabled (set to 1), after the MAC incidentally causes a collision during back pressure, it will immediately retransmit without backoff, reducing the chance of further collisions and ensuring transmit packets get sent.

BitField.name: EXCESSDEFER
BitField.description: When enabled (set to 1) the MAC will defer to carrier indefinitely as per the Standard. When disabled, the MAC will abort when the excessive deferral limit is reached.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: BTOBINTEGAP
BitField.description: BACK-TO-BACK INTER-PACKET-GAP.This is a programmable field representing the nibble time offset of the minimum possible period between the end of any transmitted packet to the beginning of the next. In Full-Duplex mode, the register value should be the desired period in nibble times minus 3. In Half-Duplex mode, the register value should be the desired period in nibble times minus 6. In Full-Duplex the recommended setting is 0x15 (21d), which represents the minimum IPG of 960 ns (in 100 Mbps mode) or 9.6 us (in 10 Mbps mode). In Half-Duplex the recommended setting is 0x12 (18d), which also represents the minimum IPG of 960 ns (in 100 Mbps mode) or 9.6 us (in 10 Mbps mode).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: NBTOBINTEGAP2
BitField.description: NON-BACK-TO-BACK INTER-PACKET-GAP PART2. This is a programmable field representing the Non-Back-to-Back Inter-Packet-Gap. The recommended value is 0x12 (18d), which represents the minimum IPG of 960 ns (in 100 Mbps mode) or 9.6 us (in 10 Mbps mode).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: NBTOBINTEGAP1
BitField.description: NON-BACK-TO-BACK INTER-PACKET-GAP PART1. This is a programmable field representing the optional carrierSense window referenced in IEEE 802.3/4.2.3.2.1 'Carrier Deference'. If carrier is detected during the timing of IPGR1, the MAC defers to carrier. If, however, carrier becomes active after IPGR1, the MAC continues timing IPGR2 and transmits, knowingly causing a collision, thus ensuring fair access to medium. Its range of values is 0x0 to IPGR2. The recommended value is 0xC (12d)

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RETRANSMAX
BitField.description: RETRANSMISSION MAXIMUM.This is a programmable field specifying the number of retransmission attempts following a collision before aborting the packet due to excessive collisions. The Standard specifies the attemptLimit to be 0xF (15d). See IEEE 802.3/4.2.3.2.5.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: COLLWIN
BitField.description: COLLISION WINDOW. This is a programmable field representing the slot time or collision window during which collisions occur in properly configured networks. The default value of 0x37 (55d) represents a 56 byte window following the preamble and SFD.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MAXFLEN
BitField.description: MAXIMUM FRAME LENGTH. This field resets to the value 0x0600, which represents a maximum receive frame of 1536 octets. An untagged maximum size Ethernet frame is 1518 octets. A tagged frame adds four octets for a total of 1522 octets. If a shorter maximum length restriction is desired, program this 16-bit field.

BitField.name: SPEED
BitField.description: This bit configures the Reduced MII logic for the current operating speed. When set, 100 Mbps mode is selected. When cleared, 10 Mbps mode is selected.

BitField.name: SCPQ
BitField.description: SHORTCUT PAUSE QUANTA. This bit reduces the effective PAUSE quanta from 64 byte-times to 1 byte-time.

BitField.name: TESTPAUSE
BitField.description: This bit causes the MAC Control sublayer to inhibit transmissions, just as if a PAUSE Receive Control frame with a nonzero pause time parameter was received.

BitField.name: TESTBP
BitField.description: TEST BACKPRESSURE. Setting this bit will cause the MAC to assert backpressure on the link. Backpressure causes preamble to be transmitted, raising carrier sense. A transmit packet from the system will be sent during backpressure.

BitField.name: SCANINC
BitField.description: SCAN INCREMENT. Set this bit to cause the MII Management hardware to perform read cycles across a range of PHYs. When set, the MII Management hardware will perform read cycles from address 1 through the value set in PHY ADDRESS[4:0]. Clear this bit to allow continuous reads of the same PHY.

BitField.name: SUPPPREAMBLE
BitField.description: SUPPRESS PREAMBLE. Set this bit to cause the MII Management hardware to perform read/write cycles without the 32-bit preamble field. Clear this bit to cause normal cycles to be performed. Some PHYs support suppressed preamble.

BitField.name: CLOCKSEL
BitField.description: CLOCK SELECT. This field is used by the clock divide logic in creating the MII Management Clock (MDC) which IEEE 802.3u defines to be no faster than 2.5 MHz. Some PHYs support clock rates up to 12.5 MHz, however. The AHB bus clock (HCLK) is divided by the specified amount. Refer to Table 160 below for the definition of values for this field.

BitField.name: RESETMIIMGMT
BitField.description: RESET MII MGMT. This bit resets the MII Management hardware.

BitField.name: READ
BitField.description: This bit causes the MII Management hardware to perform a single Read cycle. The Read data is returned in Register MRDD (MII Mgmt Read Data).

BitField.name: SCAN
BitField.description: This bit causes the MII Management hardware to perform Read cycles continuously. This is useful for monitoring Link Fail for example.

BitField.name: REGADDR
BitField.description: REGISTER ADDRESS. This field represents the 5-bit Register Address field of Mgmt cycles. Up to 32 registers can be accessed.

BitField.name: PHYADDR
BitField.description: PHY ADDRESS. This field represents the 5-bit PHY Address field of Mgmt cycles. Up to 31 PHYs can be addressed (0 is reserved).

BitField.name: WRITEDATA
BitField.description: WRITE DATA. When written, an MII Mgmt write cycle is performed using the 16-bit data and the pre-configured PHY and Register addresses from the MII Mgmt Address register (MADR).

BitField.name: READDATA
BitField.description: READ DATA. Following an MII Mgmt Read Cycle, the 16-bit data can be read from this location.

BitField.name: BUSY
BitField.description: When 1 is returned - indicates MII Mgmt is currently performing an MII Mgmt Read or Write cycle.

BitField.name: SCANNING
BitField.description: When 1 is returned - indicates a scan operation (continuous MII Mgmt Read cycles) is in progress.

BitField.name: NOTVALID
BitField.description: When 1 is returned - indicates MII Mgmt Read cycle has not completed and the Read Data is not yet valid.

BitField.name: MIILINKFAIL
BitField.description: When 1 is returned - indicates that an MII Mgmt link fail has occurred.

BitField.name: SADDR2
BitField.description: STATION ADDRESS, 2nd octet. This field holds the second octet of the station address.

BitField.name: SADDR1
BitField.description: STATION ADDRESS, 1st octet. This field holds the first octet of the station address.

BitField.name: SADDR4
BitField.description: STATION ADDRESS, 4th octet. This field holds the fourth octet of the station address.

BitField.name: SADDR3
BitField.description: STATION ADDRESS, 3rd octet. This field holds the third octet of the station address.

BitField.name: SADDR6
BitField.description: STATION ADDRESS, 6th octet. This field holds the sixth octet of the station address.

BitField.name: SADDR5
BitField.description: STATION ADDRESS, 5th octet. This field holds the fifth octet of the station address.

BitField.name: RXENABLE
BitField.description: Enable receive.

BitField.name: TXENABLE
BitField.description: Enable transmit.

BitField.name: REGRESET
BitField.description: When a 1 is written, all datapaths and the host registers are reset. The MAC needs to be reset separately.

BitField.name: TXRESET
BitField.description: When a 1 is written, the transmit datapath is reset.

BitField.name: RXRESET
BitField.description: When a 1 is written, the receive datapath is reset.

BitField.name: PASSRUNTFRAME
BitField.description: When set to 1 , passes runt frames s1maller than 64 bytes to memory unless they have a CRC error. If 0 runt frames are filtered out.

BitField.name: PASSRXFILTER
BitField.description: When set to 1 , disables receive filtering i.e. all frames received are written to memory.

BitField.name: TXFLOWCONTROL
BitField.description: Enable IEEE 802.3 / clause 31 flow control sending pause frames in full duplex and continuous preamble in half duplex.

BitField.name: RMII
BitField.description: When set to 1 , RMII mode is selected; if 0, MII mode is selected.

BitField.name: FULLDUPLEX
BitField.description: When set to 1 , indicates full duplex operation.

BitField.name: RXSTATUS
BitField.description: If 1, the receive channel is active. If 0, the receive channel is inactive.

BitField.name: TXSTATUS
BitField.description: If 1, the transmit channel is active. If 0, the transmit channel is inactive.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Fixed to 00

BitField.name: RXDESCRIPTOR
BitField.description: MSBs of receive descriptor base address.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Fixed to 000

BitField.name: RXSTATUS
BitField.description: MSBs of receive status base address.

BitField.name: RXDESCRIPTORN
BitField.description: RxDescriptorNumber. Number of descriptors in the descriptor array for which RxDescriptor is the base address. The number of descriptors is minus one encoded.

BitField.name: RXPRODUCEIX
BitField.description: Index of the descriptor that is going to be filled next by the receive datapath.

BitField.name: RXCONSUMEIX
BitField.description: Index of the descriptor that is going to be processed next by the receive

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Fixed to 00

BitField.name: TXD
BitField.description: TxDescriptor. MSBs of transmit descriptor base address.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Fixed to 00

BitField.name: TXSTAT
BitField.description: TxStatus. MSBs of transmit status base address.

BitField.name: TXDN
BitField.description: TxDescriptorNumber. Number of descriptors in the descriptor array for which TxDescriptor is the base address. The register is minus one encoded.

BitField.name: TXPI
BitField.description: TxProduceIndex. Index of the descriptor that is going to be filled next by the transmit software driver.

BitField.name: TXCI
BitField.description: TxConsumeIndex. Index of the descriptor that is going to be transmitted next by the transmit datapath.

BitField.name: CRCERR
BitField.description: CRC error. The attached CRC in the packet did not match the internally generated CRC.

BitField.name: LCE
BitField.description: Length check error. Indicates the frame length field does not match the actual number of data items and is not a type field.

BitField.name: LOR
BitField.description: Length out of range. Indicates that frame type/length field was larger than 1500 bytes. The EMAC doesn't distinguish the frame type and frame length, so, e.g. when the IP(0x8000) or ARP(0x0806) packets are received, it compares the frame type with the max length and gives the "Length out of range" error. In fact, this bit is not an error indication, but simply a statement by the chip regarding the status of the received frame.

BitField.name: DONE
BitField.description: Transmission of packet was completed.

BitField.name: MULTICAST
BitField.description: Packet's destination was a multicast address.

BitField.name: BROADCAST
BitField.description: Packet's destination was a broadcast address.

BitField.name: PACKETDEFER
BitField.description: Packet was deferred for at least one attempt, but less than an excessive defer.

BitField.name: EXDF
BitField.description: Excessive Defer. Packet was deferred in excess of 6071 nibble times in 100 Mbps or 24287 bit times in 10 Mbps mode.

BitField.name: EXCOL
BitField.description: Excessive Collision. Packet was aborted due to exceeding of maximum allowed number of collisions.

BitField.name: LCOL
BitField.description: Late Collision. Collision occurred beyond collision window, 512 bit times.

BitField.name: GIANT
BitField.description: Byte count in frame was greater than can be represented in the transmit byte count field in TSV1.

BitField.name: UNDERRUN
BitField.description: Host side caused buffer underrun.

BitField.name: TOTALBYTES
BitField.description: The total number of bytes transferred including collided attempts.

BitField.name: CONTROLFRAME
BitField.description: The frame was a control frame.

BitField.name: PAUSE
BitField.description: The frame was a control frame with a valid PAUSE opcode.

BitField.name: BACKPRESSURE
BitField.description: Carrier-sense method backpressure was previously applied.

BitField.name: VLAN
BitField.description: Frame's length/type field contained 0x8100 which is the VLAN protocol identifier.

BitField.name: TBC
BitField.description: Transmit byte count. The total number of bytes in the frame, not counting the collided bytes.

BitField.name: TCC
BitField.description: Transmit collision count. Number of collisions the current packet incurred during transmission attempts. The maximum number of collisions (16) cannot be represented.

BitField.name: RBC
BitField.description: Received byte count. Indicates length of received frame.

BitField.name: PPI
BitField.description: Packet previously ignored. Indicates that a packet was dropped.

BitField.name: RXDVSEEN
BitField.description: RXDV event previously seen. Indicates that the last receive event seen was not long enough to be a valid packet.

BitField.name: CESEEN
BitField.description: Carrier event previously seen. Indicates that at some time since the last receive statistics, a carrier event was detected.

BitField.name: RCV
BitField.description: Receive code violation. Indicates that received PHY data does not represent a valid receive code.

BitField.name: CRCERR
BitField.description: CRC error. The attached CRC in the packet did not match the internally generated CRC.

BitField.name: LCERR
BitField.description: Length check error. Indicates the frame length field does not match the actual number of data items and is not a type field.

BitField.name: LOR
BitField.description: Length out of range. Indicates that frame type/length field was larger than 1518 bytes. The EMAC doesn't distinguish the frame type and frame length, so, e.g. when the IP(0x8000) or ARP(0x0806) packets are received, it compares the frame type with the max length and gives the "Length out of range" error. In fact, this bit is not an error indication, but simply a statement by the chip regarding the status of the received frame.

BitField.name: ROK
BitField.description: Receive OK. The packet had valid CRC and no symbol errors.

BitField.name: MULTICAST
BitField.description: The packet destination was a multicast address.

BitField.name: BROADCAST
BitField.description: The packet destination was a broadcast address.

BitField.name: DRIBBLENIBBLE
BitField.description: Indicates that after the end of packet another 1-7 bits were received. A single nibble, called dribble nibble, is formed but not sent out.

BitField.name: CONTROLFRAME
BitField.description: The frame was a control frame.

BitField.name: PAUSE
BitField.description: The frame was a control frame with a valid PAUSE opcode.

BitField.name: UO
BitField.description: Unsupported Opcode. The current frame was recognized as a Control Frame but contains an unknown opcode.

BitField.name: VLAN
BitField.description: Frame's length/type field contained 0x8100 which is the VLAN protocol identifier.

BitField.name: MC
BitField.description: MirrorCounter. In full duplex mode the MirrorCounter specifies the number of cycles before re-issuing the Pause control frame.

BitField.name: PT
BitField.description: PauseTimer. In full-duplex mode the PauseTimer specifies the value that is inserted into the pause timer field of a pause flow control frame. In half duplex mode the PauseTimer specifies the number of backpressure cycles.

BitField.name: MCC
BitField.description: MirrorCounterCurrent. In full duplex mode this register represents the current value of the datapath's mirror counter which counts up to the value specified by the MirrorCounter field in the FlowControlCounter register. In half duplex mode the register counts until it reaches the value of the PauseTimer bits in the FlowControlCounter register.

BitField.name: AUE
BitField.description: AcceptUnicastEn. When set to 1, all unicast frames are accepted.

BitField.name: ABE
BitField.description: AcceptBroadcastEn. When set to 1, all broadcast frames are accepted.

BitField.name: AME
BitField.description: AcceptMulticastEn. When set to 1, all multicast frames are accepted.

BitField.name: AUHE
BitField.description: AcceptUnicastHashEn. When set to 1, unicast frames that pass the imperfect hash filter are accepted.

BitField.name: AMHE
BitField.description: AcceptMulticastHashEn. When set to 1, multicast frames that pass the imperfect hash filter are accepted.

BitField.name: APE
BitField.description: AcceptPerfectEn. When set to 1, the frames with a destination address identical to the station address are accepted.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: MPEW
BitField.description: MagicPacketEnWoL. When set to 1, the result of the magic packet filter will generate a WoL interrupt when there is a match.

BitField.name: RFEW
BitField.description: RxFilterEnWoL. When set to 1, the result of the perfect address matching filter and the imperfect hash filter will generate a WoL interrupt when there is a match.

BitField.name: AUW
BitField.description: AcceptUnicastWoL. When the value is 1, a unicast frames caused WoL.

BitField.name: ABW
BitField.description: AcceptBroadcastWoL. When the value is 1, a broadcast frame caused WoL.

BitField.name: AMW
BitField.description: AcceptMulticastWoL. When the value is 1, a multicast frame caused WoL.

BitField.name: AUHW
BitField.description: AcceptUnicastHashWoL. When the value is 1, a unicast frame that passes the imperfect hash filter caused WoL.

BitField.name: AMHW
BitField.description: AcceptMulticastHashWoL. When the value is 1, a multicast frame that passes the imperfect hash filter caused WoL.

BitField.name: APW
BitField.description: AcceptPerfectWoL. When the value is 1, the perfect address matching filter caused WoL.

BitField.name: RFW
BitField.description: RxFilterWoL. When the value is 1, the receive filter caused WoL.

BitField.name: MPW
BitField.description: MagicPacketWoL. When the value is 1, the magic packet filter caused WoL.

BitField.name: AUWCLR
BitField.description: AcceptUnicastWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: ABWCLR
BitField.description: AcceptBroadcastWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: AMWCLR
BitField.description: AcceptMulticastWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: AUHWCLR
BitField.description: AcceptUnicastHashWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: AMHWCLR
BitField.description: AcceptMulticastHashWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: APWCLR
BitField.description: AcceptPerfectWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: RFWCLR
BitField.description: RxFilterWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: MPWCLR
BitField.description: MagicPacketWoLClr. When a 1 is written, the corresponding status bit in the RxFilterWoLStatus register is cleared.

BitField.name: HFL
BitField.description: HashFilterL. Bits 31:0 of the imperfect filter hash table for receive filtering.

BitField.name: HFH
BitField.description: Bits 63:32 of the imperfect filter hash table for receive filtering.

BitField.name: RXOVERRUNINT
BitField.description: Interrupt set on a fatal overrun error in the receive queue. The fatal interrupt should be resolved by a Rx soft-reset. The bit is not set when there is a nonfatal overrun error.

BitField.name: RXERRORINT
BitField.description: Interrupt trigger on receive errors: AlignmentError, RangeError, LengthError, SymbolError, CRCError or NoDescriptor or Overrun.

BitField.name: RXFINISHEDINT
BitField.description: Interrupt triggered when all receive descriptors have been processed i.e. on the transition to the situation where ProduceIndex == ConsumeIndex.

BitField.name: RXDONEINT
BitField.description: Interrupt triggered when a receive descriptor has been processed while the Interrupt bit in the Control field of the descriptor was set.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRUNINT
BitField.description: Interrupt set on a fatal underrun error in the transmit queue. The fatal interrupt should be resolved by a Tx soft-reset. The bit is not set when there is a nonfatal underrun error.

BitField.name: TXERRORINT
BitField.description: Interrupt trigger on transmit errors: LateCollision, ExcessiveCollision and ExcessiveDefer, NoDescriptor or Underrun.

BitField.name: TXFINISHEDINT
BitField.description: Interrupt triggered when all transmit descriptors have been processed i.e. on the transition to the situation where ProduceIndex == ConsumeIndex.

BitField.name: TXDONEINT
BitField.description: Interrupt triggered when a descriptor has been transmitted while the Interrupt bit in the Control field of the descriptor was set.

BitField.name: SOFTINT
BitField.description: Interrupt triggered by software writing a 1 to the SoftIntSet bit in the IntSet register.

BitField.name: WAKEUPINT
BitField.description: Interrupt triggered by a Wake-up event detected by the receive filter.

BitField.name: RXOVERRUNINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt trigger on receive buffer overrun or descriptor underrun situations.

BitField.name: RXERRORINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt trigger on receive errors.

BitField.name: RXFINISHEDINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt triggered when all receive descriptors have been processed i.e. on the transition to the situation where ProduceIndex == ConsumeIndex.

BitField.name: RXDONEINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt triggered when a receive descriptor has been processed while the Interrupt bit in the Control field of the descriptor was set.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRUNINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt trigger on transmit buffer or descriptor underrun situations.

BitField.name: TXERRORINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt trigger on transmit errors.

BitField.name: TXFINISHEDINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt triggered when all transmit descriptors have been processed i.e. on the transition to the situation where ProduceIndex == ConsumeIndex.

BitField.name: TXDONEINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt triggered when a descriptor has been transmitted while the Interrupt bit in the Control field of the descriptor was set.

BitField.name: SOFTINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt triggered by the SoftInt bit in the IntStatus register, caused by software writing a 1 to the SoftIntSet bit in the IntSet register.

BitField.name: WAKEUPINTEN
BitField.description: Enable for interrupt triggered by a Wake-up event detected by the receive filter.

BitField.name: RXOVERRUNINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXERRORINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXFINISHEDINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXDONEINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRUNINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXERRORINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXFINISHEDINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXDONEINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: SOFTINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: WAKEUPINTCLR
BitField.description: Writing a 1 clears the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXOVERRUNINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXERRORINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXFINISHEDINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: RXDONEINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXUNDERRUNINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXERRORINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXFINISHEDINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: TXDONEINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: SOFTINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: WAKEUPINTSET
BitField.description: Writing a 1 to one sets the corresponding status bit in interrupt status register IntStatus.

BitField.name: PD
BitField.description: PowerDownMACAHB. If true, all AHB accesses will return a read/write error, except accesses to the Power-Down register.

BitField.name: INTSTAT0
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT1
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT2
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT3
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT4
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT5
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT6
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTSTAT7
BitField.description: Status of DMA channel interrupts after masking. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active interrupt request.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

Register.name: INTTCSTAT
Register.description: DMA Interrupt Terminal Count Request Status Register

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT0
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT1
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT2
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT3
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT4
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT5

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT6
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTTCSTAT7
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt request status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active terminal count interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active terminal count interrupt request.

BitField.name: RESERVED

Register.name: INTTCCLEAR
Register.description: DMA Interrupt Terminal Count Request Clear Register

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR0
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR1
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR2
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR3
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR4
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR5
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR6
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: INTTCCLEAR7
BitField.description: Allows clearing the Terminal count interrupt request (IntTCStat) for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - writing 0 has no effect. 1 - clears the corresponding channel terminal count interrupt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: INTERRSTAT0
BitField.description: Interrupt error status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active error interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active error interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTERRSTAT1
BitField.description: Interrupt error status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active error interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active error interrupt request.

BitField.description: Interrupt error status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active error interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active error interrupt request.

BitField.description: Interrupt error status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active error interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active error interrupt request.

BitField.description: Interrupt error status for DMA channels. Each bit represents one channel: 0 - the corresponding channel has no active error interrupt request. 1 - the corresponding channel does have an active error interrupt request.

BitField.name: INTERRSTAT6

BitField.name: E
BitField.description: DMA Controller enable: 0 = disabled (default). Disabling the DMA Controller reduces power consumption. 1 = enabled.

BitField.name: M
BitField.description: AHB Master endianness configuration: 0 = little-endian mode (default). 1 = big-endian mode.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: DMACSYNC0
BitField.description: Controls the synchronization logic for DMA request signals. Each bit represents one set of DMA request lines as described in the preceding text: 0 - synchronization logic for the corresponding DMA request signals are enabled. 1 - synchronization logic for the corresponding DMA request signals are disabled.

Register.name: LLI0
Register.description: DMA Channel 0 Linked List Item Register

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, and must be written as 0.

BitField.name: LLI
BitField.description: Linked list item. Bits [31:2] of the address for the next LLI. Address bits [1:0] are 0.

BitField.name: TRANSFERSIZE
BitField.description: Transfer size. This field sets the size of the transfer when the DMA controller is the flow controller, in which case the value must be set before the channel is enabled. Transfer size is updated as data transfers are completed. A read from this field indicates the number of transfers completed on the destination bus. Reading the register when the channel is active does not give useful information because by the time that the software has processed the value read, the channel might have progressed. It is intended to be used only when a channel is enabled and then disabled. The transfer size value is not used if a peripheral is the flow controller.

BitField.name: SBSIZE
BitField.description: Source burst size. Indicates the number of transfers that make up a source burst. This value must be set to the burst size of the source peripheral, or if the source is memory, to the memory boundary size. The burst size is the amount of data that is transferred when the DMACBREQ signal goes active in the source peripheral. 000 - 1 001 - 4 010 - 8 011 - 16 100 - 32 101 - 64 110 - 128 111 - 256

BitField.name: DBSIZE
BitField.description: Destination burst size. Indicates the number of transfers that make up a destination burst transfer request. This value must be set to the burst size of the destination peripheral or, if the destination is memory, to the memory boundary size. The burst size is the amount of data that is transferred when the DMACBREQ signal goes active in the destination peripheral. 000 - 1 001 - 4 010 - 8 011 - 16 100 - 32 101 - 64 110 - 128 111 - 256

BitField.name: SWIDTH
BitField.description: Source transfer width. The source and destination widths can be different from each other. The hardware automatically packs and unpacks the data as required. 000 - Byte (8-bit) 001 - Halfword (16-bit) 010 - Word (32-bit) 011 to 111 - Reserved

BitField.name: DWIDTH
BitField.description: Destination transfer width. The source and destination widths can be different from each other. The hardware automatically packs and unpacks the data as required. 000 - Byte (8-bit) 001 - Halfword (16-bit) 010 - Word (32-bit) 011 to 111 - Reserved

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved, and must be written as 0.

BitField.name: SI
BitField.description: Source increment: 0 - the source address is not incremented after each transfer. 1 - the source address is incremented after each transfer.

BitField.name: DI
BitField.description: Destination increment: 0 - the destination address is not incremented after each transfer. 1 - the destination address is incremented after each transfer.

BitField.name: PROT1
BitField.description: This is provided to the peripheral during a DMA bus access and indicates that the access is in user mode or privileged mode. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x. 0 - access is in user mode. 1 - access is in privileged mode.

BitField.name: PROT2
BitField.description: This is provided to the peripheral during a DMA bus access and indicates to the peripheral that the access is bufferable or not bufferable. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x. 0 - access is not bufferable. 1 - access is bufferable.

BitField.name: PROT3
BitField.description: This is provided to the peripheral during a DMA bus access and indicates to the peripheral that the access is cacheable or not cacheable. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x. 0 - access is not cacheable. 1 - access is cacheable.

BitField.name: I
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt enable bit. 0 - the terminal count interrupt is disabled. 1 - the terminal count interrupt is enabled.

BitField.description: This is provided to the peripheral during a DMA bus access and indicates that the access is in user mode or privileged mode. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x. 0 - access is in user mode. 1 - access is in privileged mode.

BitField.name: PROT2
BitField.description: This is provided to the peripheral during a DMA bus access and indicates to the peripheral that the access is bufferable or not bufferable. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x. 0 - access is not bufferable. 1 - access is bufferable.

BitField.name: PROT3
BitField.description: This is provided to the peripheral during a DMA bus access and indicates to the peripheral that the access is cacheable or not cacheable. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x. 0 - access is not cacheable. 1 - access is cacheable.

BitField.name: I
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt enable bit. 0 - the terminal count interrupt is disabled. 1 - the terminal count interrupt is enabled.

BitField.name: E
BitField.description: Channel enable. Reading this bit indicates whether a channel is currently enabled or disabled: 0 = channel disabled. 1 = channel enabled. The Channel Enable bit status can also be found by reading the DMACEnbldChns Register. A channel is enabled by setting this bit. A channel can be disabled by clearing the Enable bit. This causes the current AHB transfer (if one is in progress) to complete and the channel is then disabled. Any data in the FIFO of the relevant channel is lost. Restarting the channel by setting the Channel Enable bit has unpredictable effects, the channel must be fully re-initialized. The channel is also disabled, and Channel Enable bit cleared, when the last LLI is reached, the DMA transfer is completed, or if a channel error is encountered. If a channel must be disabled without losing data in the FIFO, the Halt bit must be set so that further DMA requests are ignored. The Active bit must then be polled until it reaches 0, indicating that there is no data left in the FIFO. Finally, the Channel Enable bit can be cleared.

BitField.name: SRCPERIPHERAL
BitField.description: Source peripheral. This value selects the DMA source request peripheral. This field is ignored if the source of the transfer is from memory. See Table 672 for peripheral identification.

BitField.name: DESTPERIPHERAL
BitField.description: Destination peripheral. This value selects the DMA destination request peripheral. This field is ignored if the destination of the transfer is to memory. See Table 672 for peripheral identification.

BitField.name: TRANSFERTYPE
BitField.description: This value indicates the type of transfer and specifies the flow controller. The transfer type can be memory-to-memory, memory-to-peripheral, peripheral-to-memory, or peripheral-to-peripheral. Flow can be controlled by the DMA controller, the source peripheral, or the destination peripheral. Refer to Table 694 for the encoding of this field.

BitField.name: IE
BitField.description: Interrupt error mask. When cleared, this bit masks out the error interrupt of the relevant channel.

BitField.name: ITC
BitField.description: Terminal count interrupt mask. When cleared, this bit masks out the terminal count interrupt of the relevant channel.

BitField.name: L
BitField.description: Lock. When set, this bit enables locked transfers. This information is not used in the LPC178x/177x.

BitField.name: A
BitField.description: Active: 0 = there is no data in the FIFO of the channel. 1 = the channel FIFO has data. This value can be used with the Halt and Channel Enable bits to cleanly disable a DMA channel. This is a read-only bit.

BitField.name: H
BitField.description: Halt: 0 = enable DMA requests. 1 = ignore further source DMA requests. The contents of the channel FIFO are drained. This value can be used with the Active and Channel Enable bits to cleanly disable a DMA channel.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TMR
BitField.description: Timer time-out.

BitField.name: REMOVE_PU
BitField.description: Remove pull-up. This bit is set by hardware to indicate that software needs to disable the D+ pull-up resistor.

BitField.name: HNP_FAILURE
BitField.description: HNP failed. This bit is set by hardware to indicate that the HNP switching has failed.

BitField.name: HNP_SUCCESS
BitField.description: HNP succeeded. This bit is set by hardware to indicate that the HNP switching has succeeded.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TMR_EN
BitField.description: 1 = enable the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: REMOVE_PU_EN
BitField.description: 1 = enable the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: HNP_FAILURE_EN
BitField.description: 1 = enable the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: HNP_SUCCES_EN
BitField.description: 1 = enable the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TMR_SET
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = set the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: REMOVE_PU_SET
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = set the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: HNP_FAILURE_SET
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = set the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: HNP_SUCCES_SET
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = set the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TMR_CLR
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = clear the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: REMOVE_PU_CLR
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = clear the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: HNP_FAILURE_CLR
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = clear the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: HNP_SUCCES_CLR
BitField.description: 0 = no effect. 1 = clear the corresponding bit in the IntSt register.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

Register.name: STCTRL
Register.description: OTG Status and Control and USB port select

BitField.name: PORT_FUNC
BitField.description: Controls connection of USB functions (see Figure 51). Bit 0 is set or cleared by hardware when B_HNP_TRACK or A_HNP_TRACK is set and HNP succeeds. See Section 14.9. 00: U1 = device (OTG), U2 = host 01: U1 = host (OTG), U2 = host 10: Reserved 11: U1 = host, U2 = device In a device-only configuration, the following values are allowed: 00: U1 = device. The USB device controller signals are mapped to the U1 port: USB_CONNECT1, USB_UP_LED1, USB_D+1, USB_D-1. 11: U2 = device. The USB device controller signals are mapped to the U2 port: USB_CONNECT2, USB_UP_LED2, USB_D+2, USB_D-2.

BitField.name: TMR_SCALE
BitField.description: Timer scale selection. This field determines the duration of each timer count. 00: 10 ms (100 KHz) 01: 100 ms (10 KHz) 10: 1000 ms (1 KHz) 11: Reserved

BitField.name: TMR_MODE
BitField.description: Timer mode selection. 0: monoshot 1: free running

BitField.name: TMR_EN
BitField.description: Timer enable. When set, TMR_CNT increments. When cleared, TMR_CNT is reset to 0.

BitField.name: TMR_RST
BitField.description: Timer reset. Writing one to this bit resets TMR_CNT to 0. This provides a single bit control for the software to restart the timer when the timer is enabled.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: B_HNP_TRACK
BitField.description: Enable HNP tracking for B-device (peripheral), see Section 14.9. Hardware clears this bit when HNP_SUCCESS or HNP_FAILURE is set.

BitField.name: A_HNP_TRACK
BitField.description: Enable HNP tracking for A-device (host), see Section 14.9. Hardware clears this bit when HNP_SUCCESS or HNP_FAILURE is set.

BitField.name: PU_REMOVED
BitField.description: When the B-device changes its role from peripheral to host, software sets this bit when it removes the D+ pull-up, see Section 14.9. Hardware clears this bit when HNP_SUCCESS or HNP_FAILURE is set.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TMR_CNT
BitField.description: Current timer count value.

BitField.name: TIMEOUT_CNT
BitField.description: The TMR interrupt is set when TMR_CNT reaches this value.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: FRAME
BitField.description: The frame interrupt occurs every 1 ms. This is used in isochronous packet transfers.

BitField.name: EP_FAST
BitField.description: Fast endpoint interrupt. If an Endpoint Interrupt Priority register (USBEpIntPri) bit is set, the corresponding endpoint interrupt will be routed to this bit.

BitField.name: EP_SLOW
BitField.description: Slow endpoints interrupt. If an Endpoint Interrupt Priority Register (USBEpIntPri) bit is not set, the corresponding endpoint interrupt will be routed to this bit.

BitField.name: DEV_STAT
BitField.description: Set when USB Bus reset, USB suspend change or Connect change event occurs. Refer to Section 13.12.6 Set Device Status (Command: 0xFE, Data: write 1 byte) on page 366.

BitField.name: CCEMPTY
BitField.description: The command code register (USBCmdCode) is empty (New command can be written).

BitField.name: CDFULL
BitField.description: Command data register (USBCmdData) is full (Data can be read now).

BitField.name: RxENDPKT
BitField.description: The current packet in the endpoint buffer is transferred to the CPU.

BitField.name: TxENDPKT
BitField.description: The number of data bytes transferred to the endpoint buffer equals the number of bytes programmed in the TxPacket length register (USBTxPLen).

BitField.name: EP_RLZED
BitField.description: Endpoints realized. Set when Realize Endpoint register (USBReEp) or MaxPacketSize register (USBMaxPSize) is updated and the corresponding operation is completed.

BitField.name: ERR_INT
BitField.description: Error Interrupt. Any bus error interrupt from the USB device. Refer to Section 13.12.9 Read Error Status (Command: 0xFB, Data: read 1 byte) on page 368

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: FRAMEEN
BitField.description: 0 = No interrupt is generated. 1 = An interrupt will be generated when the corresponding bit in the Device Interrupt Status (USBDevIntSt) register (Table 261) is set. By default, the interrupt is routed to the USB_INT_REQ_LP interrupt line. Optionally, either the EP_FAST or FRAME interrupt may be routed to the USB_INT_REQ_HP interrupt line by changing the value of USBDevIntPri.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CMD_PHASE
BitField.description: The command phase:

BitField.name: CMD_CODE_WDATA
BitField.description: This is a multi-purpose field. When CMD_PHASE is Command or Read, this field contains the code for the command (CMD_CODE). When CMD_PHASE is Write, this field contains the command write data (CMD_WDATA).

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CMD_RDATA
BitField.description: Command Read Data.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: RX_DATA
BitField.description: Data received.

BitField.name: TX_DATA
BitField.description: Transmit Data.

BitField.name: PKT_LNGTH
BitField.description: The remaining number of bytes to be read from the currently selected endpoint's buffer. When this field decrements to 0, the RxENDPKT bit will be set in USBDevIntSt.

BitField.name: DV
BitField.description: Data valid. This bit is useful for isochronous endpoints. Non-isochronous endpoints do not raise an interrupt when an erroneous data packet is received. But invalid data packet can be produced with a bus reset. For isochronous endpoints, data transfer will happen even if an erroneous packet is received. In this case DV bit will not be set for the packet.

Enum.name: DATA_IS_INVALID_
Enum.description: Data is invalid.

Enum.name: DATA_IS_VALID_
Enum.description: Data is valid.

BitField.name: PKT_RDY
BitField.description: The PKT_LNGTH field is valid and the packet is ready for reading.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. The value read from a reserved bit is not defined.

BitField.name: PKT_LNGTH
BitField.description: The remaining number of bytes to be written to the selected endpoint buffer. This field is decremented by 4 by hardware after each write to USBTxData. When this field decrements to 0, the TxENDPKT bit will be set in USBDevIntSt.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RD_EN
BitField.description: Read mode control. Enables reading data from the OUT endpoint buffer for the endpoint specified in the LOG_ENDPOINT field using the USBRxData register. This bit is cleared by hardware when the last word of the current packet is read from USBRxData.

BitField.name: WR_EN
BitField.description: Write mode control. Enables writing data to the IN endpoint buffer for the endpoint specified in the LOG_ENDPOINT field using the USBTxData register. This bit is cleared by hardware when the number of bytes in USBTxLen have been sent.

BitField.name: LOG_ENDPOINT
BitField.description: Logical Endpoint number.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: FRAME
BitField.description: Frame interrupt routing

Enum.name: LP
Enum.description: FRAME interrupt is routed to USB_INT_REQ_LP.

Enum.name: HP
Enum.description: FRAME interrupt is routed to USB_INT_REQ_HP.

BitField.name: EP_FAST
BitField.description: Fast endpoint interrupt routing

Enum.name: LP
Enum.description: EP_FAST interrupt is routed to USB_INT_REQ_LP.

Enum.name: HP
Enum.description: EP_FAST interrupt is routed to USB_INT_REQ_HP.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RXDATA
BitField.description: Receive data.

BitField.name: TXDATA
BitField.description: Transmit data.

BitField.name: START
BitField.description: When 1, issue a START condition before transmitting this byte.

BitField.name: STOP
BitField.description: When 1, issue a STOP condition after transmitting this byte.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TDI
BitField.description: Transaction Done Interrupt. This flag is set if a transaction completes successfully. It is cleared by writing a one to bit 0 of the status register. It is unaffected by slave transactions.

Enum.name: NOT_COMPLETE
Enum.description: Transaction has not completed.

Enum.name: COMPLETE
Enum.description: Transaction completed.

BitField.name: AFI
BitField.description: Arbitration Failure Interrupt. When transmitting, if the SDA is low when SDAOUT is high, then this I2C has lost the arbitration to another device on the bus. The Arbitration Failure bit is set when this happens. It is cleared by writing a one to bit 1 of the status register.

Enum.name: NO_ARBITRATION_FAILU
Enum.description: No arbitration failure on last transmission.

Enum.name: ARBITRATION_FAILURE_
Enum.description: Arbitration failure occurred on last transmission.

BitField.name: NAI
BitField.description: No Acknowledge Interrupt. After every byte of data is sent, the transmitter expects an acknowledge from the receiver. This bit is set if the acknowledge is not received. It is cleared when a byte is written to the master TX FIFO.

Enum.name: ACKNOWLEDGE_RCVD
Enum.description: Last transmission received an acknowledge.

Enum.name: NO_ACKNOWLEDGE_RCVD
Enum.description: Last transmission did not receive an acknowledge.

BitField.name: DRMI
BitField.description: Master Data Request Interrupt. Once a transmission is started, the transmitter must have data to transmit as long as it isn't followed by a stop condition or it will hold SCL low until more data is available. The Master Data Request bit is set when the master transmitter is data-starved. If the master TX FIFO is empty and the last byte did not have a STOP condition flag, then SCL is held low until the CPU writes another byte to transmit. This bit is cleared when a byte is written to the master TX FIFO.

Enum.name: BUSY
Enum.description: Master transmitter does not need data.

Enum.name: NEED_DATA
Enum.description: Master transmitter needs data.

BitField.name: DRSI
BitField.description: Slave Data Request Interrupt. Once a transmission is started, the transmitter must have data to transmit as long as it isn't followed by a STOP condition or it will hold SCL low until more data is available. The Slave Data Request bit is set when the slave transmitter is data-starved. If the slave TX FIFO is empty and the last byte transmitted was acknowledged, then SCL is held low until the CPU writes another byte to transmit. This bit is cleared when a byte is written to the slave Tx FIFO.

Enum.name: BUSY
Enum.description: Slave transmitter does not need data.

Enum.name: NEED_DATA
Enum.description: Slave transmitter needs data.

BitField.name: Active
BitField.description: Indicates whether the bus is busy. This bit is set when a START condition has been seen. It is cleared when a STOP condition is seen..

BitField.name: SCL
BitField.description: The current value of the SCL signal.

BitField.name: SDA
BitField.description: The current value of the SDA signal.

BitField.name: RFF
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full (RFF). This bit is set when the RX FIFO is full and cannot accept any more data. It is cleared when the RX FIFO is not full. If a byte arrives when the Receive FIFO is full, the SCL is held low until the CPU reads the RX FIFO and makes room for it.

Enum.name: RX_FIFO_IS_NOT_FULL
Enum.description: RX FIFO is not full

Enum.name: RX_FIFO_IS_FULL
Enum.description: RX FIFO is full

BitField.name: RFE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Empty. RFE is set when the RX FIFO is empty and is cleared when the RX FIFO contains valid data.

Enum.name: DATA
Enum.description: RX FIFO contains data.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: RX FIFO is empty

BitField.name: TFF
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Full. TFF is set when the TX FIFO is full and is cleared when the TX FIFO is not full.

Enum.name: TX_FIFO_IS_NOT_FULL_
Enum.description: TX FIFO is not full.

Enum.name: TX_FIFO_IS_FULL
Enum.description: TX FIFO is full

BitField.name: TFE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Empty. TFE is set when the TX FIFO is empty and is cleared when the TX FIFO contains valid data.

Enum.name: VALID_DATA
Enum.description: TX FIFO contains valid data.

Enum.name: EMPTY
Enum.description: TX FIFO is empty

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: TDIE
BitField.description: Transmit Done Interrupt Enable. This enables the TDI interrupt signalling that this I2C issued a STOP condition.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_TDI_INTE
Enum.description: Disable the TDI interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_TDI_INTER
Enum.description: Enable the TDI interrupt.

BitField.name: AFIE
BitField.description: Transmitter Arbitration Failure Interrupt Enable. This enables the AFI interrupt which is asserted during transmission when trying to set SDA high, but the bus is driven low by another device.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_AFI_
Enum.description: Disable the AFI.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_AFI_
Enum.description: Enable the AFI.

BitField.name: NAIE
BitField.description: Transmitter No Acknowledge Interrupt Enable. This enables the NAI interrupt signalling that transmitted byte was not acknowledged.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_NAI_
Enum.description: Disable the NAI.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_NAI_
Enum.description: Enable the NAI.

BitField.name: DRMIE
BitField.description: Master Transmitter Data Request Interrupt Enable. This enables the DRMI interrupt which signals that the master transmitter has run out of data, has not issued a STOP, and is holding the SCL line low.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_DRMI_INT
Enum.description: Disable the DRMI interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_DRMI_INTE
Enum.description: Enable the DRMI interrupt.

BitField.name: DRSIE
BitField.description: Slave Transmitter Data Request Interrupt Enable. This enables the DRSI interrupt which signals that the slave transmitter has run out of data and the last byte was acknowledged, so the SCL line is being held low.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_DRSI_INT
Enum.description: Disable the DRSI interrupt.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_DRSI_INTE
Enum.description: Enable the DRSI interrupt.

BitField.name: REFIE
BitField.description: Receive FIFO Full Interrupt Enable. This enables the Receive FIFO Full interrupt to indicate that the receive FIFO cannot accept any more data.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_RFFI_
Enum.description: Disable the RFFI.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_RFFI_
Enum.description: Enable the RFFI.

BitField.name: RFDAIE
BitField.description: Receive Data Available Interrupt Enable. This enables the DAI interrupt to indicate that data is available in the receive FIFO (i.e. not empty).

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_DAI_
Enum.description: Disable the DAI.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_DAI_
Enum.description: Enable the DAI.

BitField.name: TFFIE
BitField.description: Transmit FIFO Not Full Interrupt Enable. This enables the Transmit FIFO Not Full interrupt to indicate that the more data can be written to the transmit FIFO. Note that this is not full. It is intended help the CPU to write to the I2C block only when there is room in the FIFO and do this without polling the status register.

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_TFFI_
Enum.description: Disable the TFFI.

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_TFFI_
Enum.description: Enable the TFFI.

BitField.name: SRST
BitField.description: Soft reset. This is only needed in unusual circumstances. If a device issues a start condition without issuing a stop condition. A system timer may be used to reset the I2C if the bus remains busy longer than the time-out period. On a soft reset, the Tx and Rx FIFOs are flushed, I2C_STS register is cleared, and all internal state machines are reset to appear idle. The I2C_CLKHI, I2C_CLKLO and I2C_CTL (except Soft Reset Bit) are NOT modified by a soft reset.

Enum.name: NO_RESET
Enum.description: No reset.

Enum.name: RESET
Enum.description: Reset the I2C to idle state. Self clearing.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CDHI
BitField.description: Clock divisor high. This value is the number of 48 MHz clocks the serial clock (SCL) will be high.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: CDLO
BitField.description: Clock divisor low. This value is the number of 48 MHz clocks the serial clock (SCL) will be low.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: RESERVED
BitField.description: Reserved. Read value is undefined, only zero should be written.

BitField.name: I2C_CLK_EN

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_I2C_CLOCK

BitField.name: OTG_CLK_EN

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_OTG_CLOCK

BitField.name: AHB_CLK_EN

Enum.name: DISABLE_THE_AHB_CLOC

Enum.name: ENABLE_THE_AHB_CLOCK
Enum.description: Enable the AHB clock.

BitField.name: PINMASK0
BitField.description: Fast GPIO physical pin access control. 0 = Controlled pin is affected by writes to the port's SETx, CLRx, and PINx register(s). Current state of the pin can be read from the PINx register. 1 = Controlled pin is not affected by writes into the port's SETx, CLRx and PINx register(s). When the PINx register is read, this bit will not be updated with the state of the physical pin.

Register.name: PIN0
Register.description: Port Pin value register using FIOMASK.

BitField.name: PINVAL0

BitField.description: Fast GPIO output value Clear bits. Bit 0 in CLRx controls pin Px[0], bit 31 in CLRx controls pin Px[31]. 0 = Controlled pin output is unchanged. 1 = Controlled pin output is set to LOW.

BitField.name: COUNTFLAG
BitField.description: Counter Flag

BitField.description: Timer Clock Source

BitField.description: Tick Interrupt Enable

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable SysTick Timer

BitField.name: RELOAD
BitField.description: Value to load into the SYST_CVR when the counter is enabled and when it reaches 0

BitField.name: CURRENT
BitField.description: The current value of the SysTick counter

BitField.name: NOREF
BitField.description: Indicates whether the device provides a reference clock to the processor

BitField.name: SKEW
BitField.description: Indicates whether the TENMS value is exact

BitField.name: TENMS
BitField.description: Reload value for 10ms (100Hz) timing, subject to system clock skew errors

BitField.name: DISDEFWBUF
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables write buffer use during default memory map accesses

BitField.name: DISMCYCINT
BitField.description: When set to 1, disables interruption of load multiple and store multiple instructions

BitField.name: IMPLEMENTER
BitField.description: Implementer Code

BitField.name: VARIANT
BitField.description: Variant Number

BitField.name: PARTNO
BitField.description: Part Number

BitField.name: REVISION
BitField.description: Revision Number

BitField.description: NMI set-pending bit

BitField.description: PendSV set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSVCLR
BitField.description: PendSV clear-pending bit

BitField.description: SysTick exception set-pending bit

BitField.name: PENDSTCLR
BitField.description: SysTick exception clear-pending bit

BitField.name: ISRPENDING
BitField.description: Interrupt pending flag

BitField.name: VECTPENDING
BitField.description: Indicates the exception number of the highest priority pending enabled exception

BitField.name: RETTOBASE
BitField.description: Indicates whether there are preempted active exceptions

BitField.name: VECTACTIVE
BitField.description: Contains the active exception number

BitField.name: TBLOFF
BitField.description: Vector table base offset field

Register.name: AIRCR
Register.description: Application Interrupt and Reset Control Register

BitField.name: VECTKEY
BitField.description: Register key

BitField.name: ENDIANESS
BitField.description: Data endianness bit

BitField.name: PRIGROUP
BitField.description: Interrupt priority grouping field

BitField.name: SYSRESETREQ
BitField.description: System reset request bit

BitField.name: SEVONPEND
BitField.description: Send event on pending bit

BitField.name: SLEEPDEEP
BitField.description: Controls whether the processor uses sleep or deep sleep as its low power mode

BitField.name: SLEEPONEXIT
BitField.description: Indicates sleep-on-exit when returning from Handler mode to Thread mode

BitField.name: STKALIGN
BitField.description: Indicates stack alignment on exception entry

BitField.name: BFHFNMIGN
BitField.description: Enables handlers with priority -1 or-2 to ignore data BusFaults caused by load and store instructions

BitField.name: DIV_0_TRP
BitField.description: Enables faulting or halting when the processor executes an SDIVor UDIV instruction with a divisor of 0

BitField.name: UNALIGN_TRP
BitField.description: Enables unaligned access traps

BitField.name: USERSETMPEND
BitField.description: Enables unprivileged software access to the STIR

BitField.name: NONBASETHRDENA
BitField.description: Indicates how the processor enters Thread mode

BitField.name: PRI_6
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 6 (UsageFault)

BitField.name: PRI_5
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 5 (BusFault)

BitField.name: PRI_4
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 4 (MemManage)

BitField.name: PRI_11
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 11 (SVCall)

BitField.name: PRI_15
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 15 (SysTick)

BitField.name: PRI_14
BitField.description: Priority of system handler 14 (PendSV)

BitField.description: BusFault on unstacking for a return from exception

BitField.description: Imprecise data bus error

BitField.name: PRECISERR
BitField.description: Precise data bus error

BitField.name: IBUSERR
BitField.description: Instruction bus error

BitField.name: DIVBYZERO
BitField.description: Divide by zero UsageFault

BitField.name: UNALIGNED
BitField.description: Unaligned access UsageFault

BitField.name: NOCP
BitField.description: No coprocessor UsageFault

BitField.name: INVPC
BitField.description: Invalid PC load UsageFault, causedby an invalid PC load by EXC_RETURN

BitField.name: INVSTATE
BitField.description: Invalid state UsageFault

BitField.name: UNDEFINSTR
BitField.description: Undefined instruction UsageFault

BitField.name: FORCED
BitField.description: Indicates a forced hard fault, generated by escalation of a fault with configurable priority that cannot be handled, either because of priority or because it is disabled

BitField.name: VECTTBL
BitField.description: Indicates a BusFault on a vectortable read during exception processing

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the MMARVALID bit of the MMFSR is set to 1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the MemManage fault

BitField.name: ADDRESS
BitField.description: When the BFARVALID bit of the BFSR is set to1, this field holds the address of the location that generated the BusFault

BitField.name: IMPDEF
BitField.description: Implementation defined, the bits map to the AUXFAULT input signals

BitField.name: IREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU instruction regions

BitField.name: DREGION
BitField.description: Number of supported MPU data regions

BitField.name: SEPARATE
BitField.description: Support for unified or separate instruction and date memory maps

BitField.name: PRIVDEFENA
BitField.description: Enables privileged software access to the default memory map

BitField.name: HFNMIENA
BitField.description: Enable the operation of MPU during hard fault, NMI, and FAULTMASK handlers

BitField.name: ENABLE
BitField.description: Enable MPU

BitField.name: REGION
BitField.description: Indicates the MPU region referenced by the MPU_RBAR and MPU_RASR registers

BitField.description: Region base address field
